Im on the second of the Tait series! Looko.g forward yo getting the chance to continue reading. Its only drawback is that life is a bit too easy for being what could really happen! Im looking forward to see Rose show up again!
This is a well-written novel. It has a realistic view of the effects of an EMP attack. In some ways it has a optimistic view of human nature, but then I am a bit of a pessimist in that area.

Really liked this story. Kyles struggle to get from Houston back to Montana during a time of utter chaos is probably what would really happen in the event of such an attack. And we have no way of preventing such attack. I wonder if there's going to be a second Tate story I haven't looked yet.

I bought this today and here I am several hours later done already. I couldn't put it down. While I was almost certain of the ending, I wasn't bothered by this. It was so well written. I will be reading the next in the series.

I simply loved this book.  It was entertaining, exciting, informative and most enjoyable.  It brings a vitally important peril to the attention of the American people.  Buy this book and be prepared for a great ride...
I really enjoyed this book. A little predicable at times but a worthwhile read. Nicely don Mr. Gorham I look forward to reading the sequel.

The characters are likeable, especially the wife, and the story line is interesting, but the husband needs to wise up.  The fact that he was armed yet didn't take advantage of that to defend himself was almost unbelievable.

I've read a few post apocalyptic books. And this one is right at the top with the best. It's not the how to survival book, but a great story about Kyle trying to survive and get back home. The writing was superb, I really enjoyed the style. I kept me engaged and flipping through the pages. Great character description puts you in front of the people in the book as well as the locations. I especially enjoyed reading this survival tale from the point of view of someone who wasn't really prepared for shtf, but was able to make it through with determination and will, with the occasional help from a good Samaritan and a little bit of luck. Seems like the recipe for success in anything in life. Bravo Ray, great work.

I have read several books on this subject and this book is one of the better ones . It might have some grammer mistakes but I don't let that bother me too much . We need to remember that for these prices the authors are just starting out , and editors are a luxury . What I really liked about the book was the author did not go into painfully drawn out  prepper details . There are books to bone up on that if one would like . I just like to read more of a fiction based book like this one . Also the violence was kept to a minimum compared to some other books on this subject . I look forward to reading the second book of this series .

This was a very good read. Even though it was fictional I felt there were many truths. I am looking forward to his next book. It was a fast read and told a lot about how we are so dependent on our computers, electricity and the government. I hope this never happens but you are hearing more about EMP these days. I ENJOYED THIS BOOK FROM THE BEGINNING TO THE END.  MY LAST 20 years in the navy were working with nuclear weapons and I found the story realistic and frightening.

Well done!

This is the second book I have read on this subject and I can't put it out of my head. It really gave you something to think about, and maybe get a plan together or at least start talking about what you would do if it ever happens. Our world is a very scary place these days and I believe it is a very real possibility that this could actually happen. Very well written book, it was refreshing to see the lengths a man would go to get back to his family and the bond he had with his wife. Looking forward to the second book.
Ok this is an alright story. Could be better but it was entertaining. Can't decide if I want to continue the seris or not.
It's a compelling read. The premise is riveting. I liked the author's realisation that the most powerful force we humans know is love folllowed by lust.

I and his wife would have forgiven him if he had cuddled up in a warm bed for a night. A bit too sentimental about the family and the missing husband. A fearful story though and some thing that could happen.
A eye opener and reminder what it would be like without power. Great human interest and interesting characters.stayed up half the night reading, didn't want to put it down

I thoroughly enjoyed this book.  The threat of an EMP haunts me, so this is a subject of interest.  Gorham keeps the reader wondering if Kyle will actually make it home.  I am looking forward to reading the next book and am so glad that this will be a series.

There's plenty of action in this apocolyptic novel but it's not as depressing as some of the novels that picture the world after an EMP hits.  The author is good in making you care for his characters but I think his main character is kind of a wimp.  Some people would call that a "nice guy" but to me he was a wimp.  I still liked him anyway.
Riveting!  Great characters and good writing.  Much food for thought. Makes you think about how you would manage such a situation.

This book was compelling.  I cheered for protaganists Kyle and Jennifer throughout.  Events portrayed during his saga to return to his family were realistic and believable, however pleasant or unpleasant.  The terrorists who put the destruction into motion were not given much description and seemed vague characters, but that didn't take away from the main thrust showing the all-encompassing effects of a major EMP on ordinary people and their determination to survive and find their loved ones.  Good read.
I lived through this part of history.  I remember it being a very scary & dangerous time.  I remeber being very glad that it was resolved.
This book was a page turner couldn't put it down. The way he wrote about human nature and how Kyle survived his trip and the adversity that he went thru
Interesting read. Very believable. Will definitely read next book. I liked the good moral character of not only the main players but the majority of those met along the way.
I really enjoyed this book. Have recommended it to family and friends as well. Looking forward to more books from this author

This was pretty good, another book about the end of modern things in the US. It was not as bleak as Joshua to which it was somewhat similar. The main character works for the electric company and is helping out after a storm in a different state when an emp is set off over north america. The story goes back and forth with his wife at home in a northern state. It how's how she is coping with things. Actually the story could be a little better, I have had better and more creative main characters.  Try henry turtledove,s eruption trilogy. This book has  sequel but I only read the sample,  some of these books can be combined they are not that long ndi am not rich. Interesting read.

This book has opened up my eyes about what really could happen in our world today. It was a page turner and I couldn't put it down. I had to finish it day 2 of reading. Looking forward to more from this author.

I've been on a zombie apocalypse reading kick lately, but decided to take a break from that to read about a more realistic situation that could occur (sadly). This book was extremely well written and had almost zero editing issues, which made it a "two thumbs up" reading experience for me. I liked the main characters and there was plenty of action in the story line to keep me wondering what was going to happen next. It really made me wonder how I (and my neighbors) would fare if our country shut down because of an EMP strike. (It really COULD happen some day, but God forbid!) I'm glad there's now a second book available because I really want to see how the Tait family evolves during the continuing crisis. Buy this book. You won't regret it!!
Gives you a good idea of something's that could happen after an EMP. Makes you think about if you would be ready
A page turner for sure , really makes u think abt how prepared u r for disaster....or how unprepared u r rather

A realistic & uplifting look at life immediately after TEOTWAWKI.  It demonstrates that you don't have to be a high speed death machine to survive.  It also serves as a strong reminder that if you love your family, you will prepare them for life without you.  Looking forward to the sequel.

I found the story riveting, and it really made me think about how fast and how much our world could change. I had to keep reading to find out how it all turned out, but the flowery, fluffy, never ending descriptions of events of the moment, and feelings, and thoughts made this a tedious read.  If you skim through 30-40% and skip to the parts that are actually relevant to the main story line, it's a very interesting book.  The reviewer that said this book had a great pace has much more patience than I do.

This book was a great read!  Well written and full of suspense. The characters were realistically portrayed  and representative of the average American  family. The author did a fantastic job of pulling the reader into the minds of the characters to almost experience the events of the story  first hand. I couldn't put the book down  and read it in a day!
Getting the next installment want to find out how the Kyle Tait family makes out and what happens next. Recommended
I enjoyed this book and will read the next book in the series.  It was well written and well edited, and as believable as books of this nature can be.

I really enjoyed this book.  It made me think about what I would do.  How far would I go for food, water, and shelter.  How far would I go to protect what is mine.  How long would I last?  Looking forward to the next book.

We have been talking about this kind of event and what would we do if it actually happened. This book really makes you think about survival of the fittest and the chaos that would transpire. I'm ready for his next book to see how Kyle Tait and his family make it through such an unthinkable event. Very good read.
I really liked following all of the characters in this book.  It is definitely something to think about -- this could easily happen and Mr. Gorham laid it out in a thoughtful, yet exciting, way !

I chose this book because I wanted to know more about the EMP bomb. This book gave realistic facts along with believable characters and events. The ending gave hope. I would recommend this book to anyone who is open to learn what could happen in the US and how to survive.

America has produced another talented story teller in Ray Gorham.  His first novel is a classic example of the story-teller's art.  It is written in a way that will keep  you flipping the pages until you get to the end.  It covers one man's trek of 1500 miles across a continent paralyzed by a preemptive nuclear strike that exposes him to the best and the worst in human behaviors.  I started reading this book this morning and could not put it down.  Thank you Ray Gorham for a ripping good tale.

What a ride! A very realistic portrayal of a "what would happen if..." situation. No teenagers hooking up, no impossible last minute saves, just two people trying to survive until they are reunited again. And while you do kind of wonder what happened next, there are no major questions left unanswered, and you get a satisfactory conclusion to a rollercoaster story.
Keep me on the edge of my seat from the beginning and until the end.  Felt like I was with him the whole way.
The character Kyle, faces a long journey home to be with his family. This is a realistic view of how life will be in the event of a down grid in our country. Definitely an enjoyable read.
This is a well written thriller with lots of twist and turns.  A modern day Odyssey.  The characters are well developed and deep.  This book was a real page turner.  Highly recommended.
Really makes you realize Judy's how dependent we've become on everyday conveniences!  Made me think more seriously about disaster preparedness.

People need to listen to your story. It is required reading for all if they want to survive, they must prepare. It was a great example of what we need to be human and good as God intended. Thanks for writing the book and for the web sites you sugest.  Got to start the next book in the series.

Captivating story that kept me turning the pages. Actually this was my second reading of the book in preparation for reading his sequel, "Daunting Days of Winter". I don't usually read a book twice so that tells you something...
This one left me wondering what in the world happened to Chicago and wanting more. Three children emerge from a bunker to a destroyed city.
A terrifying "what if" situation told with human spirit.  The suspense will keep you reading page after page.  Looking forward for more books from this author.
I like to consider the unraveling of society after an attack such as an EMP. I think the author did a good job simply touching on some of the ramifications of such an event. Worth a quick read.
This book was great! I couldn't put it down. It gives you inspiration for what one can endure for love and family.

If you believe the government will always be there to take care of you, you need to read this book.  This book covers a large number of scenarios from a major calamity, through the strength to survive and the courage of love.  It is easy to read, has a lot of action and adventure. It is not a sex novel.  It is a story of love and survival.  It shows how we all need help to survive.
This book is fast moving, once I started reading, I couldn't put it down.  This book makes you think, what would you do in this situation.

This book follows the story of Kyle Tait, stranded in Houston after an EMP attack fries the entire North American electrical grid.  He has to walk home to his family in Montana in a country that has been turned back to a pre-industrial state.  Imagine, no electricity, no cars, no grocery stores, no communication. All as a result of one nuclear blast in the atmosphere.  It was chilling to think of my own life under such circumstances.  Well done story.
Already on to the next one.  I thoroughly enjoyed this books.  I learned a lot as clearly this could happen.

Well written and an entirely plausible scenario. This one really makes you think about life without all our conveniences we have today. What would you do if suddenly we were shocked back into the 1800s? Could you survive? Can't wait too read the sequel.

I thought this novel opened my eyes to the potential that I was aware existed but had never give much thought to the particular ramifications that would be faced by individual lives if such a far reaching disaster were to occur. Should be import information for every citizen even though it is done as fiction. Good plot and interesting characters coping with the unthinkable.
Great writing, believable story line. Made me purchase the sequel right away. I would recommend this book and it's sequel.
Exceptionally well written. Would highly recommend. Looking forward to reading the next book in the series! Keep on writing in this series!!

This book give is something that felt very personal to me. There is nothing i worry about more than my wife and kids and how well they will do until i get to them, in any situation, especially if this scenario ever unfolds! I hope i that they will be prepared enough wether it takes me a couple hours or months. Thanks for a great read and different things to consider .

Really good. I enjoyed reading this book and the one following this one. Makes you think about what if this happens are we ready. I find myself thinking about the people in the book and I need to get back to reading but I have finished reading. Is there a third book.

Gorham puts together a very good story. If you are a reader of apocalyptic fiction much of the explanation of what occurs from an EMP will be familiar to you. Good story line, that echos today's concerns with national security and survival, It will draw you in and keep you interested.
Loved this story.  I always like ones that COULD happen.  Terri Blackstock has a book on the same topic, but it was a solar flair and was more detailed.  This had a lot of suspense and a good ending!

I bought this book because the price was right and the premise looked interesting. What I found was a story that was both riveting and hard to put down. I literally read this book in just a few sittings and it kept me captivated. No one likes to imagine the worst happening to the United States, but it does provide great insight and how unprepared we are in the event of a catastrophe.
it was a very good book, one that was easy reading but not easy to put down.  unlike others of this subject it had a very good ending.
I really enjoyed 77 Days in September. My only disappointment as the author did not say what had happened to the people that helped the hero through his journey home.

I liked the subject and how the story was kept interesting.  I just kept reading as I wanted to know what was going to happen next,  When I finished 77 Days in September I had to buy the next book of the ongoing story.  I hope there will be a third book of the continuing story.

This was a very good book. Although I was aware of EMP, this is the first time I've read anything with its effects as the core of the plot.  Be prepared to not want to put this novel down, but to also to be thinking about your personal impact from a similar situation.  The writing was smooth and professional; I could easily see this book turned into a screen play for a great movie.

77 Days in September is about one family and how they cope after a major EMP.  It is well written and well done from a technical perspective.  It is easy to identify with the main characters as the writer made them like someone you might have living next door.
Interesting and very believable.  Characters were well developed and the story line flowed well.  I would share it with friends.

Well written, good dialog, and pertinant to our time. Maybe those Preppers have it right. This illustrates how important it is to be prepared to support yourselves 6 to 12 mo.  Learn to garden and save seeds. I really liked this very believable wake-up call.
could not put it down.  realistic and in this crazy world, it could occur.  stock up your stores for survival and plan for the unknown future.

I really enjoyed this book. Just the right blend of tension and hope, and it made me think, as well. The ending was wonderful, especially the last five lines. I appreciated the lack of graphic violence, though there was opportunity for the book to slide off into that. I recommend it as a great read.

I've read a lot of the end of the world type novels and I must say that this series is one if my favorites. The main character is believable, likable, moral, and tenacious. It is a must read for those who are teotwawki literate. Can't wait for the next in the series.

Nice story, but it covers a very serious subject and in a very superficial way. It was hard to believe that even though the event had targeted the US, there was no aid from outside sources for months. There would have been a massive global response to a localized disaster.
Most interesting book and very well-written. Have already bought the sequel. Author uses good sentence structure and there are very few typos. Real pleasure to read.

LOVED THIS BOOK!  The authors description of the nuclear event puts fear into you right away.  Soon you see how the country and its people have been changed forever.  An amazing story of a mans brutal journey to reunite his family and reclaim the life they once knew. After finishing this book, I immediately bought the second book.  Ray Gorham is my new favorite author!

Commitment and love to ones' family.  I read so many books and haven't found one until 77 Days that is filled with commitment, determination and Pure Love......Not a romance Novel.........but a great testiment to true love.........Read it, you'll love it!
Excellent in all aspects.  I would like to speak with the author.  Very perceptive of interactions of characters.  High quality interactions of all people.

Predictable in some places and Kyle doesn't show much street sense but a good book that puts a regular family man in an irregular circumstance that is all together possible.  I bought the next book in the series, I hope it keeps up with the first.

I really, really enjoyed this book! Many of us have bought kindle books that were poorly written (a few free books have not been worth their price),  so it was a real treat to read this book. Keep up the good work and go ahead and quit your day job!

Thought the story was a possibility in our future.  Interesting main character.  Thanks for having him true to his wife (what a surprise).  Once the main character left on his trek, I couldn't stop reading.

This was a captivating read and the sequel is just as good. Great story-line which is not far-fetched at all. I hope Mr. Gorham writes another book in this series.

KYLE's odessey in making it to his wife and children was a real "page Turner". The idea of an event that literally send us back to the Stone Age is fearful and thought-provoking. Gorham needs to write a follow-up.
This book was very exciting--- telling a story of what could really happen in America. I couldn't put it down.
You won't regret reading this book.  Could this actually happen sadly yes it can.  I'm ready to read book two in The Kyle Tait Series.

I LOVED this book. It was well written and very entertaining. While the concept is terrifying and all-too-real of a possibility, the book was filled with courage and hope. I look forward to additional offerings by this talented new writer and am off to purchase Daunting Days of Winter, the next book in this series...

what a book! I have read all the James Wesley rawles novel's, one second after, and this is right up there with the whole theme, and quality if not better. I got sucked in right away and stayed on a crazy ride, with relatable characters and vivid details that at one point in the book when there was a snow storm I actually physically got cold even though it was 70 degrees in my house. it was easy to visualize like a movie as you read along. so good that I read it in 2 days. can't wait to read the next one to see what happens next. also I read some of the reviews that criticized the grammar, but you hardly notice as you go through the text. also I really liked that at the end of the book there was a teaser of the next novel that picks up where this one ends, enticing you to find out what's next. hope this helps, now click purchase and enjoy the ride!
This was my first time reading Ray Gorham's work. I found it engaging and fast paced. I'm a fan and am looking forward to reading the next novel in the series!!!!!

I thought it was an excellent book, exciting & frightening in parts & also a bit of romance.  Some bits were a wee bit slow for me but overall I thought it was great.  And thought-provoking as well.  I bought it as a gift for my partner, he's looking forward to reading it.  Highly recommended!!

This was a great read! I loved the story line and the character's. Well written, would highly recommend. I felt like I was with Kyle on his journey home, I felt his pain and hope. I thought the people he came across on his journey were true to life....Some good, some bad. Thank you Mr. Gorham for taking me out of my world and into the Tait family!

Author says he's a new writer, but he surpassed a lot of current end-of-the-world-fad writers by a long shot!  Beautiful love story without the predictable cheesy stuff. Unique, riveting story line--I couldn't put it down.  And loved the ending!

Very well written story of survival through determination and the love of family.  I was deeply engrossed through the entire book.  Excellent read for people who like survival stories and a beautiful love story too.
a love story. would of liked to have more action. sorta a soft story teens would like to read but keeps adults attention.

Another independent author -- a treasure! Ray Gorham is a talented writer with a fascinating story to tell. I plan on getting the sequel!

Unlike most novels in the genre this story line reflects a more realistic human factor with a "normal" person with little to know preparations who has to improvise and adapt to survive the collapse of infrastructure.  Be prepared....once you start this book you won't be able to stop until you know what happens.
I could hardly put the book down. Even though it was fiction it was based on real facts.  It was very thought provoking .
I thoroughly enjoyed reading this novel.  I enjoyed it so much I had to order the next in the series, "The Daunting Days of Winter".
Good read. Except the main character being such a wuss. Other than that. A bargain! Want to read book #2!!!!
Cannot believe this is a new author.  Amazing story! Could not stop reading.  Cannot believe this is a new author.  Could have been reading Child's or Sandford.  Great read!

Very good book. Very believable plot, great characters, and both well developed. I really cared about the characters. I couldn't put it down! And now I have to buy the next book! Ray Gorham - thanks for the great story! Keep em coming!
Well written. There are some gaps in the story, but overall this author demonstrates quality in his work. Easily recommendable.

Great idea.  I just wish he had done more with it.  I could imagine lots of interesting plot twists but it rapidly degenerated into the usual shoot 'em up.  Also it seemed like the author lost interest about two thirds of the way through.  Too bad he couldn't think up anything good on the way through Montana.  I would have liked to know more about the technical end of things.  How did they go about fixing the infrastructure.  What exactly did people do to survive...stuff like that.

Interesting story, well told with possible scenarios and thought provoking idea. I think that there would probably be more confrontation than shown but who knows because we have become a nation of sheep and wolves

All-in-all a decent read.  A few sophomoric parts, mainly too trusting for the conditions.  I wondered why he didn't use a small motor scooter or dirt bike for his travels, rather than walking.  Would have been much better, and plenty of gas along the roads.

What a surprise, a book about real people and how they might react in nation wide crisis.  Deals with human feelings how they have to make life survival decisions that is against their nature and other people make harsh decisions that affect their neighbors negatively.  I am currently reading the second sequel.

I just read 77 Days and found it to be great, realistic and believable.  The hero isn't totally skilled and knowledgeable, but real with honest information gaps.  The troubles he has with his journey struck me as honest and possible.  I wouldn't expect all strangers to be welcoming, or dangerous, but a mix, as was found by Kyle.  On his homefront I found the ordeal of his family to strike possible notes as well.  Truly enjoyed and look forward to the next book.
AND... It can happen,,  Well written and make you think!!  ALSO  very enjoyable.  You feel good even though the situation is not
Great writing for great reading.  Based on what could very well happen, the story is something just short of total suspense, and will have you experience a multitude of emotions.
Thoroughly enjoyable.  Great character development.  I will read this author again. Will be interesting to see if he can match this.
Well written and felt like I lived this life with the hero...This book upholds good morals even when there could be an excuse to live for the moment
Great, quick read. Scary to think this could actually happen. This book was a good mix of real life and fiction. Definitely recommended.
This is something my husband and I have talked about.I believe everyone should read this book and start to prepare.
How to survive in a crippled country with no infrastructure.  Will make a believer out of you, or at least it should.

I came to care about the characters as they dealt with situations. It was refreshing for the characters to find goodness and kindness as well as thuggery in a PA story. The inclusion of religion was naturally done and made sense. I am usually sensitive to typos and grammatical errors, but I recall nothing that irritated me or affected the reading process.
Good book. Could not put it down and when I had to put it down I looked forward to getting back to it.
Very realistic story of what could happen, definitelyt makes you think.  It was hard to put down once started.  .
I read this in a couple of days.  It was well written and thought-provoking.  I am about to start Daunting Days of Winter.
Enjoyed the book.  Plot was straightforward, not very deep.  Enough action to keep me interested.  I will buy the sequel.

I read this story so fast because it is a really good, but scary story. Scary not from zombies but from things that could really happen right now. I hope no one gets any ideas from these! I really liked reading about how these families acted under extreme situations- brought out the good and bad we all have. Read both and hope for a third.

I genuinely enjoyed this story and hope that Mr. Gorham has much continued success as an author.  I've read literally dozens of "survival" novels and though this one isn't full of useful tips for us prepper wannabes, it was an inspiring story.  Thanks for sharing, looking forward to more.
I think I would have been praising God when I got to Wyoming, I it was the best one I have read. I have read a lot of them.

Interesting because it could happen: today or tomorrow. I'm not a person who spends any time worried about this sort of thing. After reading this book I realized that I need to spend more time planning for the "just in case" scenarios. Well written!

This book was riveting from the first page, and had very believable characters. I was rooting for Kyle to make it home from the beginning. I think the author did a wonderful job writing this book, so much so that, as soon as I finished it, I went back online to buy the second book in the series!  Thank you, Mr. Gorham, for this series! I would highly recommend this book to everyone!
Exciting book, incredibly easy to read. I couldn't put it down because I wanted to know what happened!  A great one to take to the beach this summer!  Recommend.

What a frightening, potentially real, and fantastic book!  It makes you wonder.  I could not put it down.  To think that a man would try to walk across the country is mind boggling.  I look forward to the next book in the series.

I loved everything about this book except the very real possibility of this happening one day! I chose this book after hearing on Fox News The Kelly Files talking about how vulnerable our power grid is.  I had never even heard about it before then.  I want to know why we the citizens of the United States are not being warned of this being a real threat?  I would first like to say thank you to Ray Gorham for writing this story because I now have an awareness of this threat for the first time.  Now that being said, I had trouble putting this book down from the time I started reading it!  Everyone should read this and be a little more prepared for such an incident than they would be before reading this book!  I know it's a fiction book but just knowing how vulnerable our country is to such an attack makes it that much more interesting!  I can't wait to read the second book of the series!
One of the better written books about life after SHTF.  A very plausible plot and very few grammatical or factual errors, unlike many self-published books.  Well done!
Kyle keeps getting in trouble and then getting rescued by someone who's fortunately at hand. And the ending feels rushed, as if the author wanted to get started on the sequel.

This story could have been great, but it's hard to read past the typographical errors and poor grammar. Editors may cost a bit of money, but it's probably worth it in the long run. A good book to read.  Gets u thinking about how prepared our world is for a disaster.  Keeps u I n suspense and wanting to read more.

I thoroughly enjoyed this book. It was a fast read, and was quite exciting. The threat of an EMP pulse taking out our infrastructure is real, though most would hope, unlikely. I personally have not seen a book or movie dealing with this issue, so kudos to the author for taking it on. There was evidently a lot of research undertaken for this book, and the characters are mostly well-written, if a little simple at times. I found the writing to be a little stumbly toward the beginning, especially involving conversations between characters, but this greatly improved by the end of the book. Highly recommended, especially for the preparedness crowd.

Ray Gorham's book of the eminent danger of the EMP attacks was so spellbinding I could barely put it down. No gimmicks no tricks kyle's soul believing journey through the Midwest of America that I had returned to earlier centuries. Buy this book rest assured you're not taking a chance it is well worth what ever you paid for
This was a good read.  Although the ending was somewhat predictable there were enough events during the story to keep one interested.  I will read more books in the  future by this author.
I have read quite a few books in this genre and this is definitely one of the better ones. Well developed characters and plausible story lines. Looking forward to the next book.

With all the crazy things happening in the world today, I Can actually believe losing everything on the U.s. power grid.  This book should be read by everyone.  The book was well written and  a thought-provoking read.  Makes me want to go out and purchase food, gas, batteries to store in case of a disaster.

This book was scary but accurate in its portrayal of life after an EMP strike! I like the way it's told from two points of view and made me realize how hard it would be to reconnect with family, making it heart breaking. Read it in two days. I would recommend this book. Makes me want to stockpile supplies pronto!
I found the book intriguing... Easy to read and hard to put down. The story gave me a lot to think about. Disasters can happen and we should be prepared. I can hardly wait for his next book.
I enjoyed this book very much I have often wondered in the past about a EMP strike. We're a  society so dependent on electric that this could be a real threat someday.

Am recommending to everyone.  I realize something like this very well could happen and so few are prepared for it all -- we don't realize how spoiled we all are.... and So much we take for granted.  Thank you Ray Gorham for writing this & reminding us we all need to be more prepared and able to survive.
Lots of action and character.  Whether you could put yourself in this place or not, can you afford not to read this book!

I was only vaguely familiar with EMP and it's consequences but felt duly concerned as to the affects it would have on anyone living thru such a possible ordeal.  I certainly could identify with the characters and "felt" for each of them!  Hard to put the book down as I wanted to see how it ends.  Looking forward to reading more from this author.  Liked the way it was written without vulgarity.
Great story! I already bought the sequel. Kept me involved and really made me think about the possibility of this happening.

If you are reading these reviews in order to decide on trying out a new and independent author, stop and jusr buy this book. The characters are all very believable and I found myself thinking of actors who would do justice to them if this book were ever to be made into a movie and it should be. The story line itself albeit fiction is very believable. It is the story of one mans quest to return to his family against nearly impossible odds with both nature and man forcing him to endure obstacles of which nightmares are made of,  while others along his journey reassure him that humanity has not completely abandoned him.
couldnt put it down love this kind of book plan on reading the next one too thanks for a good book
If I could give a 10 rating I would. We'll written and believe able.  Made me think how we would survive something like this.
Really enjoyed this book.  Really makes you think.  Getting ready to read the sequel hope it is as good as this one.

This is one book I will not forget. It was so like what could happen to all of us, that it was scary. I Pray that if a attack like this ever happens to our Country ,we could survive. I recommend this for all to read.
I was with Kyle every step.  Poor guy.  Kept it clean and no sex which is unusual but really good.  Hope he keeps writing.
Excellent book!  When I finished the book I immediately bought the second book.  I would highly recommend it. Couldn't put it down.

This. Story shows the human spirit at its best.The possibility of an EMP is more likely, and this book should provoke one to prepare by electing people to office who cope  with situations such as this.

A very thought provoking book. Hard to put down. Not a perfect book, however kept me interested throughout. I found myself thinking about my reactions and emotions if placed in similar circumstances. Overall I thoroughly enjoyed the book. Hopefully the scenario of the book will remain fiction forever.
I thought this going to a suspense story or spy thriller. But I was not disappointed.  This was such a good story.  Well written.  Looking forward to the next one in the series.
I enjoyed the book, I think it's very possible this could happen! Where ever you live emergency's happen! Be prepared!
hard to put this book down.  Kept you involved in characters lives, Another interesting concept of what would happen if the lights all went out.

This is my first 5 star review.  I've read books that had EMP as the subject matter, and all of them scared me, this book was no different.  I thoroughly enjoyed the character of protagonist Kyle Tait and his family.  The only criticism I have is there are no cuss words.  I do not enjoy profanity; however, the guy who stole the cart was a low-life and his dialog should've reflected as such.  All in all, an enjoyable,  well written and edited book.  Good job!

I enjoyed the book.  Well written, proofread and entertaining.  I had to put it down a couple times in frustration because I had difficulty believing anyone would be stupid enough to make some of the decisions the main characters chose.  This may be how the author views the average person to react in those situations or it was just needed to build plot to keep the story moving.  That was my only real gripe about the book, otherwise the story was a page turner and eye opening to our world as we know it being turned upside down.  I will likely buy the next book so I can see what our hero's will do next!  Thank you for writing this Ray Gorham!
enjoyed the whole book - can't wait to read the next one. sort of comforting to read that maybe some people might survive such an awful event!
This was an eye opener.  It showed what CAN happen.  It is scary to think about but we can't put our heads in the sand.  Our government needs to be prepared.

This was a good read. I liked the premise, which is why I started it. The story was Will written, the characters seemed real. Just enough details to keep it interesting. Realistic, and entertaining. Good book.

I don't usually enjoy end of the world stories, but this one was so realistic with flesh and blood characters I really cared about that I had a very hard time putting it down.  The premise was realistic--it's something I have thought about--so that made the conflicts the characters confronted more real.  I felt as if I were right there smelling the rotting body, ducking from the bullets or fighting off a sex crazed lawman.  When I found out that this was an ebook I just couldn't believe it  Any editor who rejected this book at a publisher had better get some new glasses.

Could have been better written and had poor character development. Pity, since it held some promise. I was excited by the positive reviews but was disappointed by the overall reading experience. For 99 cents, though I shouldn't complain.

As an avid reader, i am always open to something a bit different and this book was just that.  And not so outrageous that the reader might feel as though the events were impossible.  Actually the events after such a nuclear attack were quite scary.  Worth the 99 cents for sure.
I love this book, one of the best I've read In a long long time.  Characters were strong and the subject is interesting
A very believable and well written story that all ages, both male and female, I feel would enjoy. This book has a great story line that makes for a good read!

I thoroughly enjoyed this book.  It is well written and stirs one's imagination.  Kyle Tait's story is one that has the potential to happen at any time.  I believe this book may spur some on to begin to make preparations for what may come.  Remember, it wasn't raining when Noah started building the ark.  Thanks, Ray for a good read and keep up the good work.
I enjoyed the characters, situations and fast moving plot.  Ultimately it was the humanity of the main character that kept me invested in the story.
I just finished reading this spellbinding book. I started it this morning and never put it down except to eat and take my dog for a walk.  Can't wait to read the next one.
Beautifully written, can't wait to read the 2nd book, interesting info about EVP and touching story abt a family amongst the chaos
I agree with the author, We in American have our heads in the sand!! Our Government has turned their backs on God!!!
With was an exciting read!  Kept me coming back for more.  A family member recommended, so glad they did!  Get it.

I couldn't put this book down.  Well developed characters that had a variety of reactions to this "end of the world as we know it"  event.Very believable and makes one think about disaster preparedness as well.  One of the best books to come along in quite a while.  Glad I didn't listen to the worst reviews.  Now I'm off to google to explore EMP and seed banks.

I have read articles which address the bomb being set off several miles above the earth and what happens afterward.  If this does not frighten, one may be somewhat crazy, or just blind to potential danger.  The method this author uses for presenting this story is an incredible scene from the first chapter until the last. I almost never shed a tear, but............

Fast paced, great subject matter, writing, and character development.  I bought the book initially because I find prepping interesting and know that an EMP attack is probable and because the author is a fellow Montanan.  I'm certainly not disappointed and will be looking for more of Mr. Gorham's writing.
Great book. VERY scary but at least there was a good ENDING.  In real life it might not be that way.  Seemed very realistic. I hope we never have to deal anything close to this.  Pray.

Stayed up until the wee hours reading.  This is a scenario I believe we could be facing one day.  It was interesting to see how people responded to the challenges facing them.  It made me think seriously about making preparations for an emergency situation.
This could and probably will happen.  This is exactly what I would imagine It would be like.  Once I started reading this I could not stop.  I had tears at he end of the book.
Couldn't put it down. Should make it into a movie. Had everything for today's viewers. Would be an on the edge of your seat watch.Gong to buy your next book.
Great book, hard to put down!  Found myself staying up just to find out what was going to happen next!

This book is an eye opener in addition to being a neat adventure and love story.  It makes you question, what would you do if something catastrophic happened in this country which is very plausible.  How would you survive?  How would you stay warm in the winter and cool in the summer? How would you eat if there weren't grocery stores? How would you run a generator without a fuel source? How would you bathe without water?  Great book!

Premiss scary enough to grab your attention and hold it, combined with excellent author talent makes for a really good read.  Would recommend this book and author to friends and strangers alike.  Thanks, Mr. Gotham.
Great book.  Really made me stop and think about how prepared or should I say unprepared my family us for a disaster.

I immensely enjoyed this book! Every time I had to put it down to do other things, all I could do was think about it and couldn't wait to start reading it again! It's a super read....very exciting....very touching....a great read all around! And its a clean read too! Ray Gorham is an excellent author!

Ray is a great story teller, the threat of an EMP is more real than most can imagine. What happens the days and months after is frightening but the perseverance of Kyle and his family are firmly rooted in our pioneer genes. Well done sir...
I did not expect this book to be as good as it was- great charactor development and excellent plot- riveting action- I look forward to more!  Cheers!

I have read several apocalyptic novels and this is outstanding.  The full disclosure of what an EMP is and it's probable result where spot on.  I enjoyed the split story, showing Kyle's journey along with his family's struggles back home.  I appreciate the lack of 'language' as well as the lack of gruesome, bloody scenes.  I fully recommend this book.

I bought this book on a whim through a promotion email sent out (BookBub or ENT, I think, I forget which) and I've always been fascinated by end-of-days novels. I liked this book, and I finished it within 24 hours. It held my attention through MOST parts, but I did find myself skipping ahead at times. I was disappointed with the writing at the end -- it felt rushed and somewhat haphazard to me -- but overall, I recommend it.
I really enjoyed this book, kept me hooked from beginning to end, but would like to see a sequel about the time after the reunion. I want to know more about what happened next. Left me hanging.
Very good book about an attack on the USA that's stops all electric circuits. Well developed characters. Well worth your time.
Great book! Enjoyed every bit of it. Can't wait to read the next book in the series! Would love a paperback copy.

This novel is well written, the characters are defined, and the scenarios are not so far-fetched as to be considered outrageous.  I highly recommend 77 Days in September if you enjoy post-apocalyptic novels based on EMP attacks.  It's one of the best out there.

77 Days is a very entertaining read! With a realistic feel, it's like you are the one walking that long road. "Kyle" is you. He's me. He is ordinary and every day, but has the heart of a lion. This book has made it's way onto my must read list.
Interesting plot. I could imagine all the problems the characters had. Just saw a sequel had been written so I purchased that too.

As an avid reader of the post-apocalyptic genre, I was thoroughly impressed with this book. It grabbed my attention from the first pages and I found it difficult to put down. The struggles experienced by the family were realistic in nature and kept my attention without the inclusion of zombies or plagues. Without spoiling it too much for future readers, I will tell you that the plot centers around an EMP attack on the country. The attack takes place when the father/husband is away on a business trip and he struggles to be reunited with his family. At the same time, the book also focuses on the everyday struggles of his family. The author did an excellent job with character development as I found myself feeling very invested in their struggles. I highly recommend this book and my only criticism is the ending seemed somewhat abrupt....Guess I just did not want it to end.

Just finished 77 days In September  and could hardly put it down . If you are at all aware of the possibly of an EMP threat,  the author walks you through a scenario of how this could play out.  A wake up call to ways to prepare and protect . Well written and thought out. I enjoyed!

I actually learned two new prepping skills to add to my preps by reading this story so that is a plus. Wished it would have told a little of what happened to the friends he met on the way home but other then that I recommend it I also forwarded a link to it via amazon to my Facebook women's preppers group. Thanks
Great book. Loved Kyle. Jennifer should have slapped Doug the first time. I would definitely read more work by this author.
This is a very good book. At points the story rambles, mostly about the Montana situation.  However it's a very good read.
Traveling with Kyle was great. Thanks for a new adventure. This book gave me some hope of surviving the first two years after EMP.
This was one of the best post apocalyptic books I have ever read it combined believable characters, situations and beautiful writing comparable to books such as "The Road" and "Swan Song"

I really enjoyed reading 77 Days in September and really liked the fact that there was a thread of love in it as a driving force.  Most of the apocalyptic books have nothing but doom at the ends.  Plus, I could hardly put it down.  The author really knows how to capture your attention and keep it.  I give it five stars.

Out of all the books I have read, dealing with apocalyptic events, this is the first one that makes sense and has credibility. Any person of adult age should know that there is no way our government  is taking protective measures to update or guard the fragile computer managed power and communications infrastructure. The past hurricanes and winter storms of recent, should be proof of this fact.  The author takes in the best and most valuable assets the American people have - the human spirit, our sense of right and wrong, of hope, community, family and justice. Damn good book. My hats off to the author!
Great story of human Will that makes your daily hardships seem trivial. Great story,  well written, wonderful characters and multiple story lines

I love to read and I read a lot. Out of the literally thousands of books I have read there have been a handful that are so well written they are unforgettable. I just added this one to the list.  Mr. Gorham has the gift of writing a story that is so vivid you feel drawn completely into what you are reading. This book makes you examine so many things about our society, our values, the fragility of life, and the safety of a world that keeps growing more and more dependent on  technology. In addition, the characters are beautifully portrayed, vivid and memorable. Bravo Mr. Gorham. Keep writing books. You have an amazing gift

Thoroughly enjoyed this book. EMPs are something that scare me quite a bit as, just like the main character I travel a lot for work. I can't imaging having to walk home to the east coast from California. Makes me not want to leave home. The story is very good and from page 1 I had a hard time putting this book down. Great job, Ray!
Great book. Couldn't put it down.  Great storyteller.  The premise is believable, and something everyone should think about.  I wish it didn't end!
I really enjoyed your book. Keep up the good work. It makes you think . What a mess we could be in if something happened.  Good luck on future books will be looking for them. A fan Denise

As one reviewer said, this book "has all the elements." It uses the typical "journey" format to unfold a series of unforgettable characters and circumstances. I was hoping for a realistic sketch of human behavior should an EMP occur, and pretty sure Gorham nailed it. It seems some other authors have taken the potential catastrophe beyond the worst case and probably beyond reality in order to create a more dire crises for their characters. I haven't read everything in this genre, but read reviews of other books that directed me to this one, and they were right. It's just a solid story. Would love to see it as a movie.

Great read... The pages flew by and the characters were engaging.  The theme of karma was a positive note... Kyle helped others and later others helped him... One can only hope the reality will be the same!
Great book this guy starts out with nothing and doesnt lose his soul in the process of surviving trying to make it home

Man, what an awesome book! The journey is part of the story and the destination is the other and both are equally suspenseful and not without a lot of trouble along the way. We know enough about the characters to buy into the story and remain entertained throughout. This one was particularly well-written in this genre. Nothing supernatural here which I'm good either way, but do want to mention for those looking for unnatural things going bump in the night (and day) this is is not a zombie book.

Very good story line. The author didn't confuse the reader with all kinds of technical jargon about EMPs, etc., nor did he complicate the story with a myriad of characters, and the novel was just long enough to get your money's worth, but not too long that you lost interest. The story flowed well, and kept the reader interested. There were some aspects that I would have liked to author to delve into a bit, like the financial aspects of the 'event', and maybe some global repercussions, but that may have extended the story too long and taken away from the intent of the tale, which was to focus on the main character and his immediate predicament. Nice job.
Worth way more than $3.99...Best book ive read in a long time !  Hopefully Ray sticks with writing survival .

I felt the book flowed really well and the grammar,spelling etc was exceptional. The story itself was very,very moving!  I felt the pain and triumphs of Kyle and Jennifer. To me the book was worth the cost and probably should have been priced higher!

I have read a number of dystopian/end of the world type novels and found the story to be compelling and interesting. It is easy to become concerned about the characters and I think the author developed a suspenseful story that compelled you to keep reading to see what happens next. The journey to reunite a family separated after an EMP attack is an excellent vehicle to explore the various ways society would immediately change and how various types of individuals would respond to the resulting chaos. The characters were not portrayed as perfect, ready-for-the-endtime preppers, but rather as ordinary people struggling to survive a life changing event. I cared about Kyle and his family and was satisfied by the story's progression and conclusion. Kyle definitely made some mistakes, but I imagine anyone thrust into such a situation would also not be perfect. I enjoyed this novel and look forward to the author's next effort.

I like this genre of book and this one was great. Clear, edited and based on actual scenarios. I'd like to think people would be more supportive of each other but there were certainly enough of those instances as well.

I enjoyed Gorham's well-written and well paced novel. I'd read several independent novels of this genre and believe this is worth the the read. I struggled and journeyed with his main character across the country. I was right there with him, feeling his pain and his love for his family.

The author manages to keep you turning pages, in a genre that I see more as a training manual than just a work of fiction.  But I sometimes felt like shaking the main protagonist and telling him to man-up!  But, it is a story after all, and who knows how people will react in a world without order. I guess not everyone has the courage and wisdom to be ruthless in order to survive in a world without law, where the weak will surely die.  A good read and I look forward to reading more from this writer.

In recent times I have read many stories about the collapse of our society and this is one of the better ones I have read. Ray, I want to thank you for your time and effort in putting this story together. I highly recommend this story as a warning about what can happen and as a testament to one mans desire to reunite with his family in the face of tragedy. I is good to find a book that shows how human compassion can still exist when the world is turned upside down. There will always be evil in the world but this book also highlights the good that we are all capable off even in the most extreme circumstances. Please read this book and you will be inspired with the determination of good people caught in the mist of a desperate situation. Thanks again Ray for the great story.

What a great book! I couldn't put this one down and I found myself telling everyone about this story. It's an eye opener that really makes you wonder what kind of person you would become if something like this really happened. This is a must read!

This author hit the nail on the head. We are vulnerable. His description of a post EMP society was well written without being overly dramatic. I also appreciate the lack of typos! Thank you for shining light on this subject and educating the public on the severity of our situation.
Good read. As with other book's of this nature, this one is from a more personal viewpoint as he tries to get back home.

this book made me realize just how real the possibility of this happening is .  extremely well written , I had a hard time putting it down.  a good read as well as a good lesson for all Americans to remember.  this is a real threat to us all.
A gripping story that brings awareness about EMPs. It makes you think about being prepared and safety in an emergency situation. An important read.
Was entertaining enough but lacked the in-depth story about such an event. It was too much on the personal level of family.
It was a really good book. It was well written and easy to follow the story.  Would recommend this book.

Wtih the popular EMP scenario, this book's take  on the event has all of the main characters basically unprepared.  So many of the other novels have  Tier One Special Operations types, or at least ex-military taking control.  The main character and his family have no such luck.  But in fact it is dumb luck and the generosity of others that aid him on his journey.  Otherwise, he is what they term in the military as "TSTL,"  and would not have lasted anywhere near 77 days.

A very good story about one man's quest to be reunited with his family after an EMP attack. The forward of the book should be required reading of everyone and anyone who believes an EMP attack could never happen is foolish.

I like that the author did not try to make the main character a super hero. He is just an average joe who has to struggle to make it back to his family, no tactical training, no military experience, just a simple guy who works for the electric company in Montana.  Although I cant say this book is full of action, it does keep you entertained and interested throughout the entire book.  Also, I love how easy-flowing the book was, even with it being two stories combined in one..Me being a truck driver, I was mainly interested in the book because if shtf for me, most likely I will be many hundreds of miles away from home, just like the main character.

Typical EMP scenario.  Husband tries to get home to wife.  Wife trying to deal.  Average people, no preps, no skills.  At points in the book you wanna just scream at the guy "do you want to get home or not!!!!" There are unpleasant things he has to do if he is to survive and he doesn't handle it well.  I dunno...I would read One Second After or Lights Out.
Great tale of survival. Good reading and a little suspense.  I hope our government does more for us than what was written here.
I couldn't put it down! I felt like I went on the journey myself! Great read. Also has me putting together a survival kit. Thanks for this book!
I enjoyed this book so much...very entertaining read. Couldn't wait to see what happened. Highly recommend. Pretty scary though thinking it could happen
Really enjoyed this book, thought it was well thought out and captivating all the way through.  If you are looking for something in this genre with twists and turns, check it out.

What a nice story. Survival, terrorism, evil, good, and Faith and determination. Despite the bad that happens to Kyle, he stays focused on his journey, with the destination being everything, but never losing sight of the good in his heart.

This is a great story about a very real threat to our infrastructure.  Mr Gorham gives great information about such an attack and the after effects.  I loved the main characters and many of the other characters too.  It was an unflinching look at how humans behave when social structures break down.  Yet he manages within the fear to leave room for hope.  The primary message of the book is preparedness, along with old fashioned good story telling.  Everyone needs to be prepared for an emergency, if not this one, numerous others lurking on the horizon.  There are some resources mentioned at the end of the book which will help with getting started.  This is a good eye opening read, you will be glad you read it.

Main character, Kyle is a true example of American tough. More than 1000 miles from home when an EMP puts our country back to the age before electric, Kyle makes his way home to his wife and children. On foot and in constant danger, he faces the worst in some people, and the best in others. Amazing story that I'm sure to read again and again. I would like THANK Ray Gorham for this story, you have a great story here. As I read it I can see it in my minds eye because your descriptions  make it so clear, I think it would make an excellent movie.

Awesome  read Mr Gorham. I love this genre of post apocolypse stories. The excellently written characters are normal, ordinary people who endure extraordinary circumstances after an EMP attack that devastates the people and the infrastructure of the northern hemisphere of America. The title of the book indicates the amount of time it took the main character to walk home to western Montana after narrowly escaping a plane that crashed on takeoff at the end of an airport runway in Texas in September . . . with winter just around the corner. Throughout the epic struggle, neither the main character or his family knew whether the the other was alive, and the reader often wonders whether they will be by the end of the book. I don,t want to say so much that  I spoil the story. Thank you for an affordable, yet excellent book sir. It was difficult to put down. Also, Im not big on series where I have to buy several books read a great story. I'm happy that this wasn't dragged out in that way. I won't soon forget this wonderful book.

This is the first book I have read that covers a true possible catastrophe such as an EMP attack. The author did an incredible job of writing a fictional story around a very real threat. I could not put the book down and had bad dreams about the aftermath of an EMP attack. I have been aware of this kind of threat for many years and have taken steps to protect my family. I just didn't know what it would do to our society after the fact and this book helped me to understand. Thank you very much for a great read and an eye opening experience.
Hard to put down! This is first I've read from this author.  Hope there's a sequel or more in this genre by him.
Great adventure of post apocalyptic America with out too much technical info. I could not put it down.  Looking for more books by Ray Gorham
I liked that the main character was not a prepared special forces type, but just a regular guy who struggled with survival.
I couldn't put it down. Read it in a few hours. Story involves EMP (electro magnetic pulse) attack on U.S. Highly recommend.

I wanted to like this book very much but it just didn't fully deliver. The general premise and plot line are interesting but there wasn't enough there to really draw me in or make me genuinely involved. The book at times lagged and it failed to keep me engrossed throughout the entirety of the story. There were some very interesting points of the book but not enough of them. The character of the senator was brought up a couple of times and then dropped from the story line never to be discussed again. The ending came abrupt without any real climax, it kind of ended flatly. I would like to read something else from this author because in this book was the makings of a very interesting story.
I read this book in one day. Great survival story. Solid characters and the book didn't focus on too many. Realistic feel to the story.
Couldn't put this book down after I started reading. Finished it at  2 am. Captivating story with believable characters. I was almost instantly immersed in the plot and the struggles for survival. Q

I really enjoyed this book although it was scary. But scary in the way that you know that this can really happen in this world that we live in. We depend too much on computers and grocery stores and everything convenient. My grandmother was always predicting something like this happening and that people in this generation will have no idea how to live off the land or know how to preserve food. I would recommit his book wholeheartedly.
This is a very exciting story and keeps you very involved with everything that this man is going through.  A very nice love story it its own way.

I thoroughly enjoyed this book and I look for this to happen sooner than later, but on a much smaller scale. Militaries already use this technology just before a strike so it's nothing new. The main character is well developed and interesting, showing what a real man will do to reunite with and protect his family. I would recommend this novel to anyone who enjoys a good read by a talented author.
Loved the story, very realistic. Well developed characters and plot. I did not want to put it down and found myself reading in the middle of the night after being awoken by my kids.
All I can say is, this is probably how it would really happen and really be. Well done Mr. Gorham, well done.

I've read numerous EOTWAWKI books over the years and this ranks up there with the very best.I would recommend it to everyone interested in the genre. Seems like the most plausible scenarios for the stranded traveler.

I read 75 or more books a year and I review fewer than ten. This one deserves a great one. The author obviously spent a good deal of time constructing the story and characters. I thoroughly enjoyed reading it, and admit to tearing up at the end. Man was it good. The emotion was captured so well. Thanks to Mr Gorham for a memorable read.
Does credit to the genre.  The threat certainly has my attention.  I highly recommend this book if you enjoy post apocalyptic fiction.
This book is a great read and opens your eyes to the human side of a life altering incident. I look forward to more from Ray Gorham.
Very well written story that depicted a frightening possibility presented from one family's perspective.  Thought provoking and a must read!

I came across the book randomly and decided to give it a chance. It didn't disappoint and I ended up reading the whole thing in about 3 days. The plot is great, the character's relatable, and the detail given was spot on. Ray Gorham is an excellent author, and I'll make sure to buy his next book. Keep up the good work!
I really thought this was a well written book and it held my attention so much so that I could not put this down.  I read this in record (for me) time.  Very thought provoking.

I really enjoyed the way this author writes!  He gives just enough detail but doesn't go on and on about describing a room or an object.  The storyline was great and from the first page it kept my interest all the way through.  I couldn't put the book down.  I laughed and cried while reading this book and it kept me on the edge the whole time wondering what was going to happen next!  Thank you Ray Gorham for a terrific book!!!
Great story of love and faithfulness. Nice to read a book without "colorful" language. Hope to see and read more of your books.  Thanks!

I don't know when I have enjoyed a book as much as I did this one.  I think the public should prepare for this type of catastrophe  as we never know when one could strike.  The book was interesting from beginning to the end and I rate it a high five.
I started and finished this book on a flight.......could not put it down!! Very interesting read and kept me on the edge of my seat!!

This book is a fast paced story, never a dull moment. Also, a good survival story without being over preachy. Don't listen to the people nip picking every detail or decision of the hero. Just read and enjoy!
I couldn't put it down. The book didn't dwell too long on the different instances. That kept it flowing quickly.
Very good book detailing a man's journey to get home after an EMP attack. This is a book you won't want to put down!

Great book, I really enjoyed reading it.  I finished the book in just a few hours of reading spread over a few days.  I purchased this to take with me on a trip, but I could not stop reading it.  Now I have to find another book for my trip!
A great fast paced realists book. It could happen,I hope it dosent. I hope our government can get there act together and become the government for the people by the people and for the people.

You have the knack for making a great writer.  I enjoyed your first novel and hope that you will continue to use your talent.  It has movie quality too.  Your storyline has a reality about it; grabs the reader full attention and maintains it.

I wasn't sure what to expect when I picked this one up.  I'm familiar with EMPs and having electronics protected etc.  The book touched on things that I hadn't put much thought into...such as what happens if you're not close to home when it happens.  Really enjoyed the twists and turns.
I love books like this! This book was amazing. The thought of an EMP going off is something that none of us think about even though it is a very real situation that could happen. It's frightening.

It has more depth than I was expecting upon reading the first few chapters. Other than working in a few right-leaning messages it's pretty well written. (Although there are many odd spac ing issues like that in the Kindle iPad version). He keeps it exciting and gritty without going over the top in the gore department. And yes, you'll be concerned about EMP's and the like after reading this.

A well laid out story. A good insight to one man's soul. Due to the shortness of the story, it isn't as detailed as many are. It centers around two main characters and few others play a very prominent role. It is fairly short but delightful none-the-less.
Just wasn't a page turner.  Very well written, but it just lacked exciting action for me that I've come to expect from this genre.
My first book on my kindle. first time reading a book by Ray Gorham and am glad I gave him a try!!!!!!!
Not much complexity.  Easy to read in two sittings.  I enjoyed it and would recommend to anyone wanting a simple storyline about the potential effects of an EMP.
Great story finally I like the plot line and how he made his way from Texas to Montana.  Makes you think a lot about what would really happen when the power goes out.
Love the story great writing, an inspirational survival story filled of hope , really good book I highly recommend it
Better than I expected. Couldn't put it down. I recommend this to anyone who likes these types of books!  :)

In the beginning of the book, I found a lot of grammatical issues. I felt the story rushed and I could tell the author was inexperienced. I kept reading and by the second half of the book, he seemed to figure things out and his writing improved a lot. It is worth reading. Don't stop a few days in or you will miss a good story. I found it extremely refreshing to find that our protagonist was a moral man and the story writer obviously decided to have the book stand on its own merits instead of filling it with pages of gore and sex like so many of this genre do. I appreciate your efforts in that regard and look forward to your next book. If you redo the first half and rerelease it, it would make another star from me.

Once I started it, I couldn't put it down. There were twists I didn't expect. A few small parts didn't ring true, but that's the case with most books, and this was a truly entertaining story. The end wasn't quite what I expected, which made it that much better.

A most enjoyable read, Mr. Gorham.  Great character development.  Refreshing to see an author who isn't determined to fill the pages with steamy scenes and coarse conversation.  Keep up the writing, Mr. Gorham.  Glad to have you aboard.  Keep writing, please.
Good story and character development. Not a lot of macho unrealistic skill sets. Not a lot of survival lessons taught.
Read this book in a day.  Have read many of this type.  This one is clean, believable and very well written.  Enjoyed.
Kept me on edge of seat. Read in 2  days. Would recommend to friends that are worried about this like alot of us
Great read. Don't over look it. I put myself in the characters shoes and boy is it a lot to think about!
I liked it, couldn't put it down and found myself encouraging the main character to stay safe.  A good read from the usual.

The author goes very deep into the travels of the main character, but only touches lightly on the chaos going on around the country.  While an EMP would theoretically shut down the power grids, cell service, cars, etc., the military, Red Cross, & other organizations would still exist.  It's just a bit of a stretch.
Very well written, suspenseful, yet realistic. I would like to see this author write a follow-up book, or at least another book in this genre.

This was an excellent book that kept you mesmerized with the disaster, the characters, and the story line. The author jumped back and forth between what was happening to the family and all the dangers in between those 1600 miles of separation. Evil, compassion, fear and the love of a family reuniting hopefully will keep you on the edge of your seat!!!
Good read and hard to put down. The book is eye opening. It brings a lot of emotions. Thank you
I put myself in Kyle's shoes the whole book.  I would hope I would do the same things if I were in his place.
This was a great book, kept my attention the whole time. Great to see an author who has some morals in his writing as well.

I thoroughly enjoyed reading this book.  Would I classify it as one of the best I ever read, no, however it was highly entertaining and deserved of at least 4 stars in my opinion.  If i were a grammar Nazi, I might have had more to say.  I say read it for what it is a great story.  I do think that the story has some holes, and skims over many time-frames, leaving you wanting to know a bit more of the story.  In the brief encounters the main characters has, I was left wanting to know what happened to those people.  Maybe the author has plans on writing some of their stories also?  Overall l enjoyed this short read.

Ray Gorham ya did a good job.  I enjoyed reading your book so much more than many of the other self published books on Kindle.  Character developement and the pace kept me interested and I read it in one day.  I hope that the story continues.  Maybe it has... I'll look as soon as I'm finished with this review.  Atta Boy!

This is a well written piece with excellent character development and a riveting, and heart warming story line.  Thoroughly enjoyable. My only complaint is the fairly unbelievable naïveté of a couple of the characters given the severity of the situation
Tale of doomsday for the people of the earth.  Told from one man's long journey. It's not pretty but it is captivating and a great read for those of us into this genre.
And with a human interest story disguising tips for survival, as well as how difficult to retain morality during a disaster.
Great characters with realistic action. Engaging story line. I can't wait for his next book. It will be for certain purchase
Just an entertaining book on one mans quest to get home after a End of Days event. Good read. Enjoyable

Riveting, exciting, and makes you wonder...  Written so that it puts you into the story.  Excellent book.  Have shared it with several people and all have the same response...page turner, white knuckled effect.
The story certainly held my interest.  Knowing this could actually happen was pretty scary and I think the author did a great job of making it real.
I found this book to be a very realistic scenario of life without electricity. It held my interest the whole way. The characters were well developed and interesting. A good read.
It is one of my favorite reads..  very well written and believeable.  The characters were some of the most interesting I have read about.  The main character  is a true hero to me.
Well worth the read. Well written and for the most part, a very believable story line.  I would recommend 77 days in September.

Best book I have read in a long time!!!! Typos and other errors don't bother me, as long as I know what the author  is trying to say. I hope this book comes out in print, I would gladly make it part of my library. Keep up the good work Ray!!!!
Thank you Ray Gorham for writing one of the best books I've read in a long time!! I will definitely recommend this book to family and friends. Bright Blessings!

finished 77 Days in September by Ray Gorham and gave it 3.5 stars.  The book is very entertaining, captivating.  The descriptions made me feel I was there. Being from WY and having traveled MT - familiar territory.  I missed a brief summary (via NEWS broadcast or something) of how the rest of the world functioned while US was affected.  I agree, a threat of this sort could easily happen. Causes me to ponder.

What initially intrigued me about this book was the premise, which could be entirely possible.  What really captivated me about this book as I read it was the character development and the dual story lines.  It got to the point where I literally could not put the book down.  Well done Ray!

A real page turner. A must read if you believe an EMP is a real and serious threat. It is my prayer that American`s wake up and realize that in a major crisis you must be prepared to take care of yourself and your family. No help will be coming from the government.
This book kept my attention. Read in two days time. Hard to put down. Well written & intriguing story. Would have liked to follow more characters but that's the only negative.

Well written and accurate. The author has done his research and it shows throughout the novel. There's a nice character mix. No one to hate and no one to love. More like friends trapped in an unpredictable mess. This is certainly a page burner. Hard to not want to pick it up even if you're nearly ready to crash into the land of nod. Prepare to lose some sleep.
It was a fun enough read, although it was relatively formulaic, and at times felt like it was copy-pasted from the "How to be a good American" play book.

I loved this book! I am a big fan of apocalypse story lines that sound real, not sci-fi. This book is such a page turner, I could not put it down! It also taught me that this could really happen. Loved all the characters too!
