Very good book by an independent writer.  Really enjoyed it, REITERATES THE TRUE DANGER OF ELECTROMAGNETIC PULSE. GREAT WRITING, characters u care about and a story OF devotion and love.
This was intense. Read it in 6 hours or so. Highly recommend it!!! Makes you want to start stockpiling and renovating.
Excellent read. Not only does this book tell a great story, it is extremely realistic and gets you thinking about what would happen if an EMP really hit. A real page turner!

I found this ebook to be very intriguing . After the incident, I found myself pulling for the lead character with each page turned. I prayed  that  his journey, as rough as it was, would be successful. The book really made me think more on emergency preparedness. A real page turner. I could not put it done. Bravo

This book is based on a real potential situation in a fictitious setting ... couldn't put it down. It delves into real human psyche and made me think hard about how I would react in such a situation ... this is a must read book.

Very well written book containing a compelling story.  I read it in about two or three sittings and was sad to see it over.  The author developed the story and characters well and the ending was exciting to say the least.  For $3.99, you won't get better entertainment anywhere.
Bought the Kindle edition. Read the entire book in two sessions. Got so involved I just could not put it down. Thank you for a very good story.
great book, has a wonderful premise and a good story line.  I really really liked it, worth the read. cant wait for the second edition.
Slow pace for reading. wonderful love style story lots of things that can go wrong do. Still, I found «One Second After»the best. I did enjoy this .

Great job, Ray! I happened to start reading this while at a church mountain retreat because my cell phone had no reception and I couldn't check facebook. ;-) I couldn't put it down after that and even read it out loud to my husband.  This was well worthed the cost!
Excellent tale of perseverance, showing the best and worst of human nature. Definitely gives one something to think about.  Easy read.
I enjoyed reading this book. I'm glad I bought it for my kindle fire. It ended on a good note.
Was intrigued by the concept of the move, and came away having enjoyed the book for the most part. But not ready to add this or the author to my list of faves.
Great story, great writing...couldn't put the book down. Ray Gorham is able to put you directly into the story and feel what the characters are feeling...emotions flow!
Good reading and makes you think of possible events that could happen to us. Makes you think about preparing just in case. A trip across the country would be tough. Hard to put down. Thanks

This was a quick read.  I did not think I would have liked this book, but just could not put it down.  Definitely makes you think are you prepared?  I know I will definitely keep a few things in the basement now.  Might not want this book on a flight... Read it and find out why

The scariest thing about this book is that it could happen. It goes beyond simple survival. It touches on human emotions, fear, pain, love and friendship. I liked the links the author included at the end for heirloom seeds.

This book is an overall winner.  If you appreciate that the good guy (and gal) have morals, then you will appreciate a few of the scenarios that they are placed into.  It's not overly God-sy or religious, but there is definitely a strong element of "the right thing".  As far as action, there is quite a bit of suspense that keeps the reader coming back wondering what will be the next adventure.  This follows along well with a dystopian themed book, with a good dose of hope. For the price, it is nearer 4.5 stars than 4 (quality and quantity).  I mean, $4 for a good adventure?  Hard to come by these days!

I have interesting timing for reading this book! The government shutdown at this time makes the story much more real... The author did a great job--I felt for Kyle and Jennifer and was rooting for them. I agree that it is so important to prepare for emergencies and this book gives you hope. Thank you!
This book has a good story line and plot. It is suspenseful and interesting throughout.  It is well written and I would recommend it to anyone who enjoys a good survivalist book.
I enjoyed the journey with Kyle. I travel a lot between Northeast Texas and Houston, and have wondered what I would do if I had to make the journey home to NE Tx on foot..

This book was interesting and slightly scary when you think that something like this could really occur.  Strange as it may seem, it's very similar to a series I just read in May by a Christian author describing exactly the same scenario.  If it's that plausible by two authors, how much more plausible is it to our enemies?  Makes me think about storing water and canned goods in case of emergency.  Sort of like the bomb shelters of the late '50's.....anyway, the book was very entertaining as it shows the dark side of human nature as well as the good side.  I pray, should anything seriously happen to America in the future, that I would find myself on the good side.

I thoroughly enjoyed this book from the first page to the last.  I liked that it was extremely well written.  I had a difficult time putting the book down it was so interesting.  I highly recommend this book and I plan on reading any other books by Ray Gorham.
I really liked this book. It is worth your time. Well written and a good flowing story. Can't wait for the next book from Ray Gorham
77 Days was well written. It was simple, no hi-tech anything, and easy to follow. At the same time, it was adventurous, exciting, and written in a way to captivate the reader. Great job.

I've always "limited" myself by reading a select group of favored writers and the best part of owning my Kindel  has been the discovery of many great unknowns...this guy is one example.  To many, this book could be frightening but the threat is very real.  Throughout the adventure I found myself thinking of simple, no "panic" preparations that could be put in place for any kind of emergency.  Put all that aside and you are carried through the book feeling joy at the determination, love, and drive to survive of the characters.
I loved the book and the adventure of the story, I guess it could happen to the USA someday, hopefully not in my life time.
Makes me want to stock up on extra can goods. Loved to see this book made into a movie or television series. Gripping story.

I would recommend this book to any adult who enjoys a survival story.  The story deals with a possible and horrific event for which many of us are not prepared.  In the story as well you find that divinity doesn't alway come prepackaged in steeple form.  This is an excellent read too late I to the night story.  Buy it.  You won't be able to put it down.

Riveting read!  Purchased this on a friends recommendation. Couldn't put it down for two days now. A frightening look a what might happen if someone really wanted to hurt America, or any nation for that matter.

I must say "77 Days in September" continually had me pausing to think about, and  actually feel, what I was reading. To think about the possibility of an EMP event and know that it is all too possible. Perhaps likely. I found myself wondering if I could survive. If I would have the courage found in the characters and the strength to remain true to moral values. The ending had me in tears. And that is truest compliment I can give you, Ray Gorham. One of the most engrossing books I've read in  long time. Look forward to the next book.

This story was amazing.  I found myself unable to put my Kindle down.  This talented author took a possible scenario and put it into a fictional story that kept me wanting more.  I want to read more by this guy.  Wow!!
Hi. Read this book while traveling and enjoyed it very much. Well written and a good story line. Gave me a lot to think about.

I read one second after  and 77. I have prepared with a.closet of food.  Your book showed me I need more. Seeds plus.  Yes I enjoyed a happy ending. Thanks for a book that will be with me for a while. Sand hope I never use the info

Well written with interesting characters. Not as grim as "One Second After". Author gave good explaination of EMP at the beginning and appreciated references to actual EMP incidents related to atmospheric testing of nukes in the 1960's. A quick read.

This book has everything you could want in a book. I don't write reviews but this book has touched be enough that I want the author to know I LOVED this book. I couldn't put it down and couldn't wait to hear what happened next. Thank you so much for writing it. You did an excellent job. As for you potential readers, I have read one second after, 299 days (all of them so far) and several others and I will say this book is worthy of the time it takes to read 708 pages. I felt every emotion known to man while reading it from fear, excitement, sadness, arousal, extreme anger, and it even made me shed a tear or two (and books rarely move me to tears) but I have to say the tears of joy I experienced with this book are what has excited me enough about it to write a review and encourage you to read this story. You will not be sorry you did.
I thoroughly enjoyed this book. Not a subject matter I was familiar with but the author did an excellent job weaving explanations into the storyline. Read the book in a few days and am glad I did.

Words can't begging to describe the journey this man took to find his family.  As I started to read the book I found I couldn't put it down, it was intense, sad, comical, endearing and made you think...what would YOU do in this situation?
This was the first book I read in my birthday month and what better title than 77 Days in September. It was.  Phenomenal book and I'm really glad to see Kyle reunite with his family.
Great story, great writing and fast reading. One of the best I've read in the EMP/Disaster genre. You will not be disappointed!

I really enjoyed this book.  My only problem is that this book is about a desperate journey. A long journey (on many levels) that seemed rushed in this great story.  It is an EXCELLENT read with all the right messages: family, grit, morality, generosity, compassion, and survival.  Evil always loses.  Hope and the need to survive always triumphs  I look forward to more by this author.  I hope he digs a little deeper and takes his time to tell great stories.

I thought this book was great for PA fiction.  It wasn't predictable, as some tend to be, and I liked the double perspective that the book used to tell the story.  Very few typos, believable dialogue, interesting situations, satisfying conclusion.  I almost wish the ending had been more, well, open-ended.  I would have enjoyed reading more about the Tait family's struggle for survival through winter.  I look forward to reading more from Ray Gorham and hope that he continues writing this genre.

The story was pretty good, had some good insight. Don't know what the anti religion nuts were mad about....guess they are always mad about something. Only thing I didn't like in the book is the use of the word "tears". Someone was always crying and fighting back the tears. Guess you could play a game and drink every time the word "tears" came up, you would get a buzz. I would read the sequel.
This book is well written and kept my interest from the beginning to the end.  I recommend this book to everybody.

The thing is, if you have read lots of doomsday etc. type books, you start to know what to expect. And with this book everything was really predictable. What I really enjoy in books are those "whoa" type moments, that really suprise me and make me understand why i could never be a writer. This book didnt have any of those, but next ones hopefully do!

I like end of the world books anyway, but this one I stayed awake until 3:30 am to finish it.  A family is  separated when an EMP hits.  I didn't have to skip over sections because of gory descriptions or explicit sex.
Interesting characters, solid plot line, and enough tension to engage the reader and keep me turning the page!  Well worth the price!  Thanks!

A friend at work recommended this book.  It was inexpensive for the kindle so I knew I wouldn't be out much $ if I didn't like it...was very impressed.  I've always said it's the authors job to grab my attention within the first 3 chapters and Ray Gorham was able to accomplish this - no problem.  Shortly after starting to read this, the same scenario was discussed in the news.  Scary coincidence.  Good read. Thanks Ray for providing this entertainment.

I've read William Forstchen's 'One Second After' and have seen comparisons to this novel.  It's a fair comparison.  I think both are good but this was a more comfortable format for me.  I couldn't put it down.  There is enough good information here also to give the basic facts of the July, 1962 Starfish Prime testing so the reader of this book should be able to easily understand the very real risk of an EMP attack and the devastating consequences.  Reading this in a novel makes you feel it as well.  If you don't know about EMP at all yet this is a good place to start.
Highly recommend this book. Makes you want to get in the book and help. Will buy whatever this author writes. Thanks Ray Gorham

Very entertaining and well written. The main character is one that I could identify with as I go about my preps. Family is everything and why we do what we do to prepare. The book reinforces that notion.  It is an easy, enlightening and entertaining story.
I enjoyed reading the book even though the subject matter was a bit too real and possible. If you have ever thought about what society could become in an extreme scenario, this book is for you.

This was a very gripping novel.  I had I very difficult time putting the book down because I was so into the characters and could hardly wait to see what happened next. Most definitely made me think what I, my family, and friends would do in a similar circumstance. Very riveting and extremely thought provocative. I would certainly recommend this novel and look forward to additional works of fiction written by Ray Gorham.

This was a very interesting book and well written.  I enjoyed it and feel that it is possible for something drastic to happen to us in America since we are so unliked by some.  I can remember how America was 77 years ago since I am 82 now.  We grew our on vegies and butchered most of our meat.  We had large farms and the farmers would sell their home grown products on highways from stands.  We are much to dependant on someone else to provide everything we need.
I enjoyed reading this book. The writing style in the first few chapters was poor- very he said she said. But it improved dramatically as the book went on and and I enjoyed it.
I confess to being ignorant about EMP's until I read this and now I am trying my best to prepare for any disaster since it is looking more and more believable.

I love post apocalyptic books, and this one was great. I identified with the main character who is hoping for the best and trying his hardest, but still struggles to make the right decisions. It's definitely worth a read. I can't wait for Gorham to release another book. I will be buying it for sure.
Good story line. Characters are easy to like and feel for. Actually made me think about what I would do in the event of this type of scenario. Will look for more books by this author.

My dear friend who is well-read and informed about current events recommended this book to me.  It was wonderfully written and so enlightening about a very real danger to our country. I was enthralled and read this book in just a few days.  It really is a reality check on what could happen and very well told.  Although I loved every part of the book and hung onto every word of his survival, I was especially touched by the poignant relationship Kyle had with Rose- so refreshing and heartwarming.  Thank you for writing this informative book and I highly recommend it to readers.

This is a engaging post EMP story of survival. The author skillfully intertwined the story of a husband and wife who survive a terrorist attack on the USA. The transitions between their separate stories are handled well. The story is believable and the main character, Kyle, is well written. The wife's side is more melodramatic and lacks clear details on how she survives with her children. It is worth reading.

This book was recommended on Amazon by a reviewer of another post-apocalypse e-book,, and its intriguing title drew me in.  The story is about an ordinary family man, Kyle, trying to make his way home from Texas to Montana where  his wife and three kids are  after an EMP attack.  The story toggles back and forth between Kyle's and his wife's  experiences .  It becomes quite clear early on that Kyle is too good-hearted and trusting for likely post-apocalypse survival, and I often found myself yelling "No!  Don't do that!" at my Kindle. Kyle's wife is not much wiser, but I will not give away key plotlines or the end.  The prose and plots flow well, moral dilemmas are reasonably well explored, and there are no major editing problems.  The book is also suitable for mature teens.

This was an interesting read with well drawn characters. Errors in easily checked facts, however, marred the story. Air Force officers do not report to sergeants, command or otherwise. No one in uniform calls a sergeant 'sir', at least not to her face and no noncommissioned officer ever calls a general officer by his first name, certainly not while they are on duty. I found it a fast read on an important topic

Good book but stressful to read before bed.  I read One Second After a couple years ago and really enjoyed it.  This book has a similar premise but different story as the character attempts to travel home (versus stay and protect home/town).  I thought the author did a good job of portraying the effects of an EMP though he didn't get much into the affect on the entire county, just a few people.  I would highly recommend this book and would read another by this author.

I really enjoyed 77 Days in September.  It gave me a good feel as to what to do and what not to do during an apocalypse or any emergency situation for that matter.  I liked the drama and the way the author kept you hanging for more at the end of each chapter.  I would highly recommend this book if not for the survival aspects but for the sheer enjoyment of a cliff-hanging drama.

I only recently came across this genre of novels based on EMP scenarios. I read a couple of samples, but some of the writing was pretty average and didn't seem to capture the urgency or passion of the potential problems. In contrast, Gorham's book succeeds, especially with the plot scenario of a man trying to get home to his family over a 1000 miles away after "the incident". That gave the story the narrative tension the others lacked, and which kept me coming back to the book at every spare moment.

I absolutely enjoyed this book from beginning to end!  I especially liked how the storyline moved back and forth between the main character and his family.  I hope this author writes many more books in this genre.

Of all the apocalyptic novels I have read this is certainly the best written. The plot is compelling, the character development excellent,and the narrative hard to put down. If this is his first book there will no doubt be more. A professional work that bespeaks a author about whom I suspect we will hear much in the future. Looking forward to his next effort.
Should this ever happen, the world would not know how to react.  Good enough read, but very predictable at times.
This is a well written and edited story. Not to take away from the story, but I would've liked to read about what helped the survivors stay alive as well as other preps.

Most similar books I've read, consisted of the main characters hunkering down to weather the storm. Usually some of them being somewhat prepared to do so. This book focuses on a main character who's  ill prepared & against all hope, is trying to get home to his family. I loved hearing about the journey Kyle went on in his desperate flight home. I couldn't put the book down & as a result finished it in less then two days :)

Great book. EMP was very well explained and it seemed that if such an event were to happen, this book presents a very realistic and human hero. I genuinely liked him and cared about him. Exciting entertaining read. Highly recommend.

77 Days in September, while a member of the long line of disaster types, is a realistic look (view) of one possible reality. It's quite scary to say the least! Had me on the edge of my proverbial seat.

I am a person who loves to read fiction stories, but this book has opened my eyes to the enjoyment of non-fiction books and to the challenges and difficulties our country faces. Thank you Ray Gorham for an amazing book.

77 Days in September was an enjoyable book.  The author did do quite a bit of research about the effects of EMP which was a nice surprise.  The parts of the plot were very predictable; the wife in danger, the husband's realizations about his marriage/family while on the road, everyone he helped lived nearby etc.  You just had to take them and go with the flow of the book.  I would be willing to read another book of this type by the author to see if his talent improves with time.  I would recommend it as it was easy read even if predictable.

This book was exciting and entertaining from start to finish. But it also sends a reminder to us that we are so susceptible to just this type of event. Sure makes me want to stock up supplies. Great read.

Five stars.  I simply couldn't put this book down. Well written, interesting characters, believable plot. I couldn't wait to see what happened next!  I'm a 49 year old man and I cried at the end! I could so relate to the main character, Kyle who was a family man and a man if integrity.
Very well written.  Enjoyable read.  Look forward to more from this author.  Keep up the good work and let us know how everyone he met on his journey survived.

I was so engrossed in this story I did not want to put it down.  The characters came to life for me.  I have become even more conscious of the impact an EMP would have on our lives.  my husband and I often talk about how we would manage through an attack.  Thanks for a great story.
Great story, amazingly believable, great characters, and one of the best books I have read in a while. Highly recommended!

I thoroughly enjoyed reading 77 days in September.  I didn't want to put the book down as I wanted to know what was going to happen to the main character next.  The book also made me think 'what would I do'.  Definitely will recommend to friends.

I really found this book compelling.  A great love story.  I am new to the EMP Apocalypse genre, but found this book compelling.  I was engrossed! I found some of the story to be a little far fetched, but as a whole I really enjoyed it!  A good read

77 days in September is a very enjoyable, easy to read book. It tells of one mans journey to rejoin his family after North America  grinds to a halt following an EMP attack.  The book explores how people react when their world is suddenly changed. We see both the good and the ugly sides of human behaviour. I would highly recommend this book to anyone.

I enjoyed the book because I enjoy suspense. The book was well written and I liked the way it flashed back and forth between the tribulations encountered on the road and did equally well describing the hardships at home. Even tough the book was fiction, it was believable.  Like the writers style. I recommend the book to anyone who likes doomsday book with a happy ending.

I couldn't put it down. The writer really kept the story going from start to exciting finish. It gives both sides of the story, the husband that's stranded 1500  miles from home and his wife that's at home protecting their children.
Made reality look pretty grim. Drew me in from thje start. Keeped reading just to know what would happen next. Pretty well written and might good nail bitting action on occasion.
I thought it was good.It was like the other prepper books I've read.I like that the main character didn't have everything already with him for survival.
I have read most of the best of this genre and  this book is now on the list of best.

I love reading the works of new authors because they aren't trapped into writing novels that are scripted and formulated based on what has sold best in the past. This book was well-written and had believable and well-developed characters. I was instantly drawn into the book and ended up reading the last 100 pages in one sitting. I also found the premise (an EMP wipes out our infrastructure and all electronics) to be particularly fascinating and not something that I've read much about. I sincerely hope to see more books by this author; I'd most certainly read them and I'd definitely recommend this book to others.

An fast moving story--kept my interest and was easy to follow.  The plot was simple and quite realistic--no super-heroes, but common folks with real problems and issues to deal with--very believable.  The story literally covers a lot of territory in a limited amount of time, so it is not overly complex and develops only a few characters.  Overall, a good, entertaining read.

Gorham's book paints a very disturbing picture - but one that could possibly happen...makes you wonder what you would do given the same circumstances - scary!!!  A good read that kept me engaged from Texas to Montana - enjoyable!
A very good read. If you liked one second after you'll love this as well. More realistic and a better storyline in my opinion.

This book is one that will grab you and not let go until the very end. It deals with what it would be like in the U.S. if we were to be hit by an EMP pulse and it deals with the love of a man for his family and what he will endure to get back to them. (And what the family endures not knowing if he is dead or alive). This book will keep you on the edge of your seat, is well written and I am looking forward to reading more by Ray Gorham.
77 Days in September was entertaining, informative and frightening.  I love that Mr. Gorham was able to inform me of this issue while entertaining me.  I recommend all Americans read.
A fast paced, truly engrossing novel...recommended to family & friends..everyone has loved it! It created some lively talk around our dinner table!
This was a very good book makes you think how fast our lives can change . I hope I can at least be some prepared .
Very good book! Kept me reading long after I should have went to bed! Well worth the money. Looking forward to other books by this author.

What would you do if you were away from home and TEOTW happened? Heck, what would you do if you were at home? This book does a great job of discussing both those questions. This story is an exciting/thoughtful adventure that makes me hope the will be more from this writer. I totally enjoyed his writing. I think he deftly presented the viewpoints of a husband/wife pair separated by unexpected adversity. Is it totally realistic? Maybe not, but I did not want a technical book. If you are looking for a good summer book with a splash of true love thrown in this is it! I will definitely read it again.
Always wondered how difficult it would be to walk across the country.  Still not sure it would be any fun.
Good read. Good story line along with good info for survival. I like that it was not a liberal bashing session and the protagonist is not someone who is prepared.

I like the concept of the EMP disaster scenario and I live in Montana, so this book was an easy sell to me. The book did seem a little short and economical in character developement, but that made for a quick read.
This is truly the best book I have read in awhile. Scary to think it could really happen.Highly recommended!!  Faith works.
It was a good read, especially for a $3.99 book.  Could have been fleshed out a bit more, but the story line was solid.  Would recommend this book

I thought this book confirmed what my wife and I had been thinking about lately, getting prepared to fend for ourselves. EMP MAY NOT HAPPEN in our lifetime,  but there are signs of other dangers that could have similar results and this story has opened our eyes to what we might face.  Well written, timely and full of good ideas about what someone would need to survive if the world as we know it suddenly ceased to exist. We highly recommend this book to anyone concerned about what is happening around the world today.
I cried at the end like a little baby I was so moved.  Excellent book very impressed.  Every time I thought I knew what was going to happen I was jerked back to the authors reality.  Good read

I really enjoyed this book, how scary and real the content of this book is!  I know that myself and family are no where near prepared for an event such as this and i do believe that such an act could happen!!!  I am so glad the characters made it and returned to their family. I hope i never have to endure anything close to the events in this book!  A great read, get it and enjoy!

just read it for the 2nd time after a discussion at work about this actually happening, couldn't put it down, my husband and 18 year old daughter have also read it and loved it, we have told relatives and friends to read this book and look forward to more from this author.
This was great...one of the best I have read in a long time. Will be looking for the next one soon

This story highlights the trials we will face when the lights go out. While the author tells a tale that's much less terrifying than what we'd likely be looking at, it's enjoyable none the less. If you are like most people you probably feel like something is wrong with the country right this second, but you can't quite see the danger. Trying to convince family and friends to prepare for any disaster is an uphill battle for most of us. Pass this story along and it will help them to understand one possible future. Hopefully the easy read will awaken them to plan for such situations without having them simply tune out.

OK it’s got the typical editing problems. The author is not world class yet, But I found the story very enjoyable, in fact I had trouble putting this one down! This is the first book in a long time that got me a little emotional at the end. I can’t remember the last time that happed. Cudo’s to you Mr. Gorham!

Riveting is a word already used, but it is the perfect word to describe this book.  I read the kindle version, and had difficulty putting it down in order to get a few hours of sleep at night.  I REALLY enjoyed this book, and I highly recommend it.  One of the things which impressed me was the great editing which is not often the case with independently published books.  I have traveled, or lived in places along the route Kyle took which made the story more enjoyable.  We are sitting ducks from EMP's.  I will take note of things mentioned in this book and pack accordingly whenever I travel in the future.  Thanks again for an excellent story.

Apocalyptic fiction can be so depressing, let's face it.  77 Days proved to be in turns realistic, scarey, inspiring and hopeful.  I simply couldn't put the e-book down, so much so that when the power was low on my Kindle I plugged in the charger and continued reading.  The next day I finished the book in our car as my husband drove us to our destination and then and only then could I finally emerge from the world of 77 Days.  I loved it.

To fellow readers - Mr. Gorham has provided a worthwhile return on my investment in this book. 77 Days in September is well written, nicely paced, and quite a bit more realistic than other "disaster novels" I have read. The characters were easy to relate to and the story was neither rushed, lagging, nor abruptly ended (which I find particularly maddening). While this book won't provide a wealth of new WTSHTF knowledge for seasoned preppers, it is a nice tidy work of fiction that was a delight to read. To Mr. Gorham - above all else (and there is much to praise) you have a real talent for character writing. I felt every emotion right alongside Kyle and Jennifer. You cost me more than a few tears of sadness, frustration, and joy... but thanks for the ride. -Lori C. in TN

I've never reviewed a book on here before, but I had to let people know what a great book this is. I could not put it down, I finished it in two days, sacrificing several hours of sleep to do so! Gorham does an amazing job of realistically describing, in detail, what the country would be like if such an attack ever occurred. Mixed in is the story of one man's determination to make it home to his family, something I think everyone can relate to. If you ever watched the television show "Jericho", this book reminds me of it...maybe mixed in with a little of the show "Revolution." Either way, it's definitely worth reading!

This overall plot in this book made it a really gripping read. I kept on going in the hope of Jennifer and Kyle being reunited. The secondary characters were also well defined and memorable.  The struggles everyone went through helped you get drawn into the story. I do wish the book went into more detail around describing USA in a post - terror attack world but otherwise an excellent read and one that I would highly recommend
So descriptive that each page of reading allowed for distinctive mental images.  Tension, fear, sadness....emotions were handed to the reader page after page.!!

I planned on dallying my way through a summer read with this one, but found myself up late and then early, unable to put it down, finishing it inside 24 hours. The voices are authentic, the issues of survival real for our pampered and ostrich-like society. I would have liked to see a little more of a twist at the end, the only reason I'm not giving it 5 stars. Kudos to this independent author, can't wait to see more from him.
Great narrative tension in the story which dragged me along and made me finish the story in one sitting. Well done.
Well written EMP novel that pulls you in...love when a writer fleshes out a character slowly and has you rooting for them the whole way!

This turned out to be a better read than I originally thought.  My only criticism is that it could have been longer with a bit more space devoted to the people Kyle meets along the way.  All in all it is a good read that deals with a real threat.

I am an avid reader always looking for something good to read.  It takes 7-10 days for me to finish a book unless I am on vacation, then 2-3 days.  I finished 77 Days In September in 3 days, while working!  I could not put it down!  The story was well written and fast pased.  I couldn't wait to see what happened next!  I look forward to more books by Ray Gorham.
This story was well-written and thought-provoking.  I now find myself visiting the possibility of such an event and wonder how our nation and my family would weather just such an event.

Ray Gorham has given us thought provoking insights into both the potential horror of an EMP attack and the power of the human spirit.  Some readers may find his faithful, determined husband and wife duet a bit difficult to believe but, for the most part, the characters are well crafted and the dystopian viewpoint quite compelling.  Definitely worth reading.
The book has a great story, is well researched and honestly is a well written book. This would make a fantastic movie. I'd recommend it. The ending does come a bit fast.

Mr Gorham's book made me realize just how dependent our society is on electronics and electricity.  Also some thoughts arose about religion that I never thought before.  I knew about EMP before reading this book but never thought about the effects on society.  It's amazing how fragile our society is and how quickly it could breakdown.  The book was interesting and enjoyable, I had a hard time putting it down.

This book is very much on par with "One Second After", in that this book grabs hold of the reader and weaves a terrific story about what life could be like after an EMP. Character development is very good as you become involved with Kyle's struggle to make it back home to his family in Montana from Dallas, Texas. This was an emotional read, at times, as you experienced his trials and failures. Very hard to put down, but real life has to interrupt the story at times. I enjoyed this Kindle version so much, I also bought the Audible version for my drive times. You will enjoy this story!

I had never given any thought nor heard anything about EMP's as a weapon, but I found the concept interesting. I was also disturbed by how easy it was to believe the "bad" parts of how quickly our society would likely deteriorate if faced with a massive crisis such as the scenario presented. I would give three stars for the story telling of the author which seemed to sometimes move slowly and become repetitive, but the fourth was well earned for the insight into our society, and the number of times he had me thinking " dang, that would probably happen exactly like that in real life" while I was reading it.

While this turned out to be more a story of the journey of the main character rather than of the technical details of the emp strike itself, it was engaging and kept me "turning the pages", so to speak. I enjoyed it!
I truly enjoyed your book. I cared about the characters and the struggles they each faced. Thank you for sharing this with all who have read it thus far. I will look for more from you.
the end of our world as we know it with just enough humanity left to thrill your heart. a truly enjoyable book.

I overall really enjoyed this book.  There were times I wanted to yell at the characters!  I really felt for them, and wanted the best for them.  Two very different perspectives of a terrible attack.  I think a lot of what happened is based on what could reasonable occur and I think society would quickly break down in a situation similar to this one.  Some things were predictable and you could see coming, others were not.  An enjoyable and interesting read.

Thought provoking and a warning as unpredictable countries get stronger and want to destroy our way of life.  Good story, believable characters and a mix of evil people and good who help the hero make his way home .  Makes me want to lay in some batteries and cans of food just in case. . . .Good work, Mr Gorham.  I wish you much success.

A plausible and yet unbelievable scenario sets the start of an action packed, heart wrenching, emotional journey with a man trying to get back to his family. The difficulties seem insurmountable, but the love for his wife and kids drives him on. I am sure you will enjoy reading this book.

I love reading this type of pa stories because of the fact that it could become reality. Makes it a little more scary that way. I enjoyed the book and the main characters struggle to get home to his family.

Definitely a book worth your time.  I was unable to put my ipad down and even when I was forced thought about the story nonstop.  Definitely shows that I need to do more to get prepared in case anything like this ever happens.
A spellbinding read, timely and important, and all too real, not if, but when. Read this book and and take heed, prepare.

77 Days in September is full of honest emotion that a man feels toward his family as he journeys over 1,600 miles to return to them after an EMP event that frighteningly is not out of the realm of realty for us all. It stirred "what if" worries in my mind and will push me to look further at the world outside my front door and appreciate what I have to enjoy. It's a great first effort for Ray Gorham.

It was a decent book. The end was good but didn't care for Kyle's character while he showed great tenacity he was a little to naive when encountering strangers especially given the fact he was a country boy from Montana. Overall it's was good it just lacked some detail and character development.

The story was good. It built tension throughout and ended happily. I had read that the author was trying to write a love story. It was that. He used the separation of the two main characters and the challenges of getting back together as the basis of the story. There were several lines that appeared to be mis written and missed by the editor or proofreader. Still all in a 'll it was a good book.
I really enjoyed this book.  I would recommend it to others who enjoy apocalyptic stories.  Makes you think what if.
A very interesting look at what could happen and why we all need to prepare for possible catastrophic events.  I couldn't find a place to stop reading.  Very interesting and well written.
AWESOME book went by far to fast. Ray thanks for the thought provoking subject . Ive started gathering somethings to safe guard my family
Like a lot of other reviewers said, this book kinda makes you think... I very much enjoyed how the author focused on one family's struggles - makes it very real...

I was glad I stuck with it. There were some errors that were obvious errors and not typos, which always annoys me. This is a more hopeful story than most of this genre, which I did enjoy. Sometimes you just need a little bit lighter tale of the apocalypse, ya' know ? There are plenty of terrible things that happen but every single thing that could go wrong doesn't happen. Probably this is a more realistic portrayal of this event because the truth is that how a person fares will have more to do with his personal situation and  the unpredictables. It is a complex interplay of things -- including our fellow man -- that will determine our fates. And this is what the book illustrates nicely. We just don't know. So, on that note, it's probably more true than stories that depict nothing but the worst of humanity. I needed a break from total gore, and this book reminded me of that.

This is the best book of this type I have ever read, bar none. This one has what most previous ones I've read, true heart. The story of two sides of a love story, a love story with a realistic modern day twist. As for the written, the author has a way of keeping the reader interested and on the edge of your seat. Hope for something new from the author soon.
I was surprised how much I liked this book. In places it was a little predictable but all in all. A great read.
Do not start this book unless you are prepared to finish it. Well written, thought provoking and gripping. Can we have more please?

This is a very well reasoned book. The plausibility of it's premise makes it more engaging than similar books about unlikely or impossible threats. The author created engaging characters and told a relatively simple story that was thought provoking. As you follow the protagonist fighting conditions for which he had not prepared, it will make you want to review your own readiness for even small disasters.
This was an Engaging story that was well written.  I literally read it in one sitting.  Great author, interesting topic, executed very well.
One of the best books I've read on this subject. I only hope I would have the courage of this family. Thank you for the adventure.

I really enjoyed this trip. Keeping the focus of the story on one character and his "quest", was great. There were a couple of side stories that really did not have any relevance on the telling of the story, but overall it was a good read.
My first read about life after an EMP strike, not sure I can identify with the way the story unfolded but still enjoyed it.

This novel brings to life the threat of a nuclear strike with the purpose of starting EMP reactions. Although the premise is somewhat chilling, the book is well written and has a moving story line involving the lives of those living through a return to the 19th century and life without it's familiar security.  Once  I started the novel I had difficulty putting it down.

The preview of this book looked interesting to me so I decided to purchase it. It was hard for me to put this book down. The author did a good job of keeping my interest and as a result it was a quick read. This book does present some scary possiblities for some of the countries that have nuclear weapons and unstable leadership which is very unnerving.
A good story with just enough facts about emp and survival,but still telling a good story. A very compelling story that makes you care for its characters. A must read for this genre.
I found this book extremely informative. I had no real clue about EMPs. It does make me want to do further research. Thanks for a great story!
Couldn't put it down. Terrific storyline and loved the ending. Was so glad the author didn't leave us hanging. Recommend highly.
Very good book! I thoroughly enjoyed reading this. So many different tragedies are possible in the world we live in anymore.
great book couldn't put it down. Hope the author writes more books I will buy his next book for sure

This novel is well researched and written. The subject is America's vulnerability to devastating attack by one of our many enemies. A single small-yield nuclear bomb, launched by a readily available missile and exploded 300 miles above the center of the country, is capable of producing an electro-magnetic pulse powerful enough to send us back to the Stone Age. This danger is known but there is little we can do about it. 77 Days in September follows a man along his torturous 1500 mile walk from Houston, Texas, to Missoula, Montana, to get back to his young family, who are struggling merely to survive in a world suddenly stripped of power, transportation, and communication. I highly recommend this book.
Found this book to be very thought provoking. It's really scary to think someone could possibly attack us like that and bring our entire country to a standstill.
More creepy than zombies because this is entirely possible.  What would we all do without modern gadgets and other conveniences?

So many books of this genre go off into little more than descriptions of which weapons the characters used to attack the bad guys.  This was different.....real day to day life. I would have liked maybe a bit more detail about the day to day life, but overall this is one of the more enjoyable books about post-EMP life.

This idea is not far off.  If it ever does happen, many will attempt yet few will succeed.  Kyle did the impossible while facing  uncertain circumstances.  I think I would've done some things differently but based on the characters back ground & lack of prep  skills his actions were on point.  Excellent read from start to finish.  Only one book!!!  This not part of a series that drags you along.  That point alone gives it top earnings from me!

I had heard from a former Coast Guard Admiral that EMPs pose a horrendous potential threat, but this book offered me more information re: them and what specific results would likely occur if our country's electronic grid is ever destroyed.  Ray Gorham also includes informative website sources for more information on EMPs and what we CAN do to be better prepared.  In addition to the educational component of this book, it's such great reading that I stayed awake ALL night, completing it.  The book is well written, with intriguing, potentially realistic plot, and especially memorable characters.  I also appreciated that my reading was not interrupted by spelling and grammatical errors.  Good for you, Ray Gorham; I look forward to reading more books by you.
kept me wanting to read on and on.  very realistic presentation of a very possible scenario.  got me to thinking about getting more prepared
This book made me consider a fallout shelter!! The tension and desperation builds quickly and is cleverly - sometimes ruthlessly - maintained throughout, until the emotional conclusion. A great read.
I enjoy a good post-apocalypse book and the premise of this actually was not too far-fetched.  Interesting characters and pretty well written.
Easy read of a fascinating and scary topic. A little predictable but thoroughly enjoyable. If this ever really happened, I believe the country is doomed

I could not put this book down.  Well written and frightfully real.  Makes me want to find a way to be self-sufficient.  To the author Mr. Gorman- please continue to write.  I will look forward to more from you.

While it would be impossible to cover every aspect of such an event, the author does a fine job of keeping the storyline moving while presenting an accurate portrayal of what could happen.  Overall, a good read regardless of your prepper position.

Incredible! Should be a movie! Not since reading Alas Babylon as a young girl, have I read anything as compelling as this! I found it amazing that a book could be both frightening and heartwarming at the same time, but it is! I was glued to the story of survival, from start to finish and it will stay in my thoughts forever. You owe it to your family to read it, trust me. Beautifully done <3
I loved this book.  It had psychological drama, edge of your seat excitement, love and romance, action, drama, you name it this book will pull you into and through it.
I found this book both thought provoking and entertaining.  It certainly makes you wonder what you would do in a situation like that and everyone hopes they would be as determined as Kyle.

This is the first review I have ever written, but when the author said that he reads these reviews, I just had to write.  I was drawn into this novel from the very beginning and could not put it down until I was finished!  Not knowing anything about EMPs prior to this reading, I am literally terrified of the thought.  Reading what your characters encountered brought the fiction to mesh with the reality should this actually occur.  I was so emotionally involved with your characters from the very start. You have a real gift of bringing your readers to empathize with your characters.  Thank you for this thought-provoking novel.  I look forward to reading more of your works.
Great  really enjoyed reading the book. Looking forward to your next project. Keep up the good work. I will look for it.
This is the best book I have read in a long time and would recommend it very highly.  Thank you very much Mr Gorham
I FOUND this book very interesting and a great read.  A little bit more detail about Kyle's journey would have nice but still a good read.
Wonderful tale of the strength of the human spirit. Couldn't put it down once I started! Good scenario of a very real threat to our country.
Frighteningly possible occurrence. A great read  showing that  above all, the human spirit and love of family can sustain and drive one to triumph against insurmountable circumstances.

I am normally not much of a reader, but personally knowing the author, made me want to read the book.  It truly is a PHENOMENAL READ!! I found it very hard to put down. Wanted to keep reading to find out what was happening next.  Really makes a person think about what could happen to this country if there was an EMP attack.  How prepared are we as individuals and how would you or I handle a situation like that? Makes a person want to do some sort of prep work. I will recommend this book to anyone who asks.

A well written book.  None of the grammar and spelling errors so many of these survival books offer.  My only hesitation about this book is its optimism.  If this are only as bad as depicted in this book, I will be greatly relieved.  But I fear they won't be...

Great story, but I was waiting to board a plane for a cross-country trip and realized too late that this was not going to be a good time to read it.  Thankfully, I finished it before the return flight home.  This is one story hard to forget....makes you look at everything in your life in a new way, realizing that this really could happen.  What transpires brings out the best in people and the worst in people...a real study in humanity.  Highly recommended.
The story was very good . I have been saying for years that this can happen in this country of ours.

What a thrilling book I've just read, "77 Days in september", excellent. I'm not a reader, my wife got it for me on nher Kindle, and I just could not put it down. So thrilling and realistic and made me really think while I was enjoying the action. This should be a movie. I'd recommend it to everyone, unless not concerned about what the future could bring. it is really an action, love story!

An interesting book about what may happen if an EMP attack occurred on the United States.  The story takes place in two places, Montana and on the road with the main character trying to return home.  The book does a good job of balancing time spent with the characters and action scenes of survival.  The characters are likable (if a bit over righteous at times) and act as I think a normal person would which sometimes has you screaming "What are you thinking" but being under that kind of stress I would imagine would cloud anyone's judgment.  A good book if you like end of the world survival reads.
I enjoyed this book.  A pretty realistic picture of an apocalyptic future.  No zombies or monsters, just people trying to survive.  Worth the money.

This book was great.  A very engrossing read.  I never thought so much about stockpiling food in the garage in my life.  I hope it never happens and I also hope he does another book exploring the road to recovery.

Finally, a post apoc book that ended with hope.  The book is a good read, a nice story and characters are well rounded.  I also appreciate the authors efforts at accuracy regarding information about EMPs.  I look forward to the next book.
This was a great book! It is an easy read. The characters are believable and likable. I'd suggest this book.
Great book with a well developed story and characters. This is one that cries out to be made into a major motion picture. Kudos to Ray Gorham. I will be looking for his next book
A very good read with well thought out details. The ride was over to soon. Thus 77 days to short. Thank you for your mesmerizing story.

Interesting concept for a novel.  Easy to read, and easy to lose yourself in.  It contains a couple errors, and the ending left something to be desired. A couple parts were too predictable or overused in novels.  But it's worth reading anyway.  I had it up at 4 stars, but then I remembered the beginning of the novel and the explanation about the terrorists and such.  It was kind of offensive to Iranians.  I get that the US and Iran have disagreements and Iran is the next door neighbor to the country that the US invaded, but I really don't like how he pinned the whole disaster on us, in a matter of like 2 paragraphs as if everyone was just supposed to accept that of course the Iranians were behind it.  Annoying.  I know someone had to be the culprit, but why not at least make it a country that the US is at war with?  It would be more realistic.  Since we never hear from "Jibril" and "Zahir" again, why even bother writing that part?  He could have just said "the terrorists" and moved on since it wasn't even important to the story.  Yuck.  With that annoyance aside, it's still worth reading, just as a fun thing to pass the time.
I read this book a few months ago but I loved it.  I learned about something I'd never heard of and now I'm paranoid lol - but it was a great story and I loved every minute of it :)

One of the finest novels I have read within the last 3 years! Factually correct and accurate description of the danger and subsequent aftermath of an EMP attack, wrapped in a truly engrossing story of a Man and his family struggling to survive. It isn't often that a novel can bring this 44 year old man to tears, but this one did! Well done Mr. Gorham and I will be looking to read all future works you pen! God bless!

I have been reading a lot of SHTF fiction lately.  This one has become one of my favorites.  The main characters are not preppers and yet still manage to overcome overwhelming odds.  I had to force myself to put it aside long enough to get some sleep. There are no zombies of any form or bloody battles, just an average family separated by a huge disaster and their fight to be reunited.  I highly recommend this book.

This is a very well written book.  If you are thinking about to buy the novel.  Buy it  it is a vey descriptive story and it is very possible that this could be the way the world we know it ends. Sometimes I felt  sad and other times i wanted to kill some of the characters so this book really captures what people might do when the s*** hits the fan. any ways  very good read.
I couldn't put this book down once I started reading it. It wasn't what I was expecting but am so glad to have had the chance to read it.
While not great literature a very enjoyable and satisfying book. Will almost certainly buy authors next book even though this is not a series (what a pleasant surprise!).

This was one of those books I didn't want to end. You go through this journey with the main character to reach his family & home. The author does a great job of drawing you in to this world. I've recommended this book to all my friends. It also makes you realize just how vulnerable this country is to an attack like this. This is one book that is stuck in my head.
77 Days in September reveals and explains a major catastrophe many Americans don't even know exists. It's the ultimate doomsday scenario and the likeliness of this happening is very possible.

I enjoyed this book very much. The writing is much better than I expected. After reading Lights Out (which I enjoyed the story but the writing was difficult) I wondered if this genre was doomed with well informed survivalists lieu of authors.  There were things that annoyed me with this book. For instance at times I felt Kyle was a wimp who almost died because he wouldn't make the hard choices, but I think he needed to be. The typical person who reads these books is someone who has prepared themselves and considered the hard things already. BUT the average person in America is more like Kyle and Jennifer. People totally unprepared emotionally for this type of crisis. I feel the author depicted things accurately.  Kudos Mr. Gorham on your first novel,  I look forward to reading more stories by you.

Not only was this book a good read, entertaining and hard to put down, it was just about as honest a depiction of the realities of life should we ever get hit by an EMP. Read this book! It will scare your toes curled and darn well SHOULD have you learning to prepare if you have not already started!

Really did love this book. Easy read and very shocked that I found myself crying at the end. Not sure if it was worth a five star, but I certainly only pick books with a four or higher as hopefully most of you do. This was a great outlook on the winter part of survival for me and I appreciate that. Great author too RAY GORHAM. Will be looking for some more of his work to read. I am a fan of post apocalypic and really loved this book. You would be silly to not buy and read. Happy reading you guys!
Fast paced, exciting, and will make you think anytime that you go on a trip.  A must read for anyone concerned with  future possiblities.
Well written and compelling story about family and love and survival.  Difficult to put down.  Thank you for writing it.
It had me wondering many things during this story "the what if", wow It pretty much covered everything. Well worth reading.
Very good novel that was well written and paced nicely.  I enjoyed this novel and its perspective on the collapse of society.

Both my husband and I could not put this book down.  Each page read drew you to the next. It was very well written and believable.  I truly hope Ray Gorham will write another book soon. 77 Days in September should be in hard copy so more people could enjoy it. Excellent!
Thourougly enjoyed.Makes one think one what you would do to survive if something similar happens to you. Let's pray that it never happens.

Amazing story that has opened my eyes to how vulnerable we are and that every citizen must take the responsibility to be prepared, because our government won't take care of us in serious,bad times. The author showed in great detail how horrible life would be but also told told a loving story of a family and some caring people. I thoroughly enjoyed this book. It was a real page turner.

I loved this post apocalyptic, almost true lifelike adventure.  The author was able to create a realistic vision of a possible future with believable characters and situations.  The book moved at a quick pace and kept my interest from the beginning to the end. I'd like to see more books like this one.

I enjoyed this book and feel that the subject is definitely something that more people need to be aware of.  The characters for the most part were well written and some very real situations were touched upon.  I was a bit disappointed that some of the characters introduced early in the book were never revisited and would have liked there to have been more expansion on them since they were included.  I do realize that the book was designed to mainly be about this one family and their interactions after the event but by introducing the military and political characters early on it left me wondering about how they were fairing in the aftermath.  Good first book and I hope the author keeps writing more.  I would definitely check out a second effort by Mr. Gorham.
I enjoyed the interaction of the story teller and the other people in the book. I read this book in one day because it wes hard to put down.
I loved this book! It kept my interest from beginning to end. Many unexpected twists and turns. It's great when you can't figure out what's coming next. This book is also good food for thought.
I really enjoyed this novel.  Great story line, excellent character development and good pacing.  Highly recommended...an independent author with an incredibly bright future ahead of him.
This book was excellent, it seems like it is very possible that it could happen. It is very hard to put down.

I purchased this book based solely on the reviews. I was hooked almost immediately. Ray Gorham did an excellent job creating characters I could empathize with...and cheer for. And a story of hope, loyalty, perseverance and love. Great job Ray! Now let's have that sequel!

This was a very entertaining and well written story.  The characters were well developed and easy to relate to.  If you are at all into reading stories about the possibilities of life post SHTF, or TEOTWAWKI, this is an excellent story. It's even one that my wife would surely like.  In fact this is one of those stories that would make a great movie.

What a great story! I couldn't put it down. Both the educational aspect and the storyline had me riveted. I can't remember the last time I was so emotionally invested in a book. I seriously balled my eyes out at the end. Thank you for that Mr. Gorham.

I enjoyed this book from beginning to end. It was very well written. The subject matter of this book is frightening, but possible. I most enjoyed the character of Kyle. He inspires hope in a time of desperation.

I really enjoyed this book and recommend it to one and all; the possibility of an EMP attack is real and families should be prepared for such a type of disaster or those caused by nature and have at least a 30 day supply of necessary items such as food, medicine, etc.

A very insightful story about survival and what people will do to survive. I found this book easy to read and because of its no frills insight into how life would be without electricity it gets one thinking about disasters and how I would survive. I think this is a book for teenagers and over to make them aware that the threat of this happening is real and would make them think as with me about survival in the city or country. I'm in my late fifties and can remember the old coolgardie cooler a very basic fridge and some of the old ways my grandparents used to live prior to all the appliances of today. I am glad I have solar power.
Best book I have read in the genre. Not too Rambo-ish as some others are.  This is a great read by a talented author!
This was a page turner! Great story and very interesting tale. Enjoy the dystopian tales, hope to ready more like this.

I could hardly put this book down once I got into it.  I felt so bad for the things Kyle experienced on his journey home.  The story was well written.  It is so frightening to think something like this could actually happen and is not out of the realm of possibility.

This book was a great read!  The characters are well developed and easy to like.  Any one with family can connect with the emotions and worries of the main character.  I recommend this book to anyone interested in a different kind of apocalyptic tale.
Very good book! Very likeable characters and an interesting perspective . I actually ended up reading it in one night!

I enjoyed this book very much.  I had already realized the importance of prepping, after sitting for over a week with no electricity following Hurricane Sandy.  This novel brought home a very plausible and real threat to prepare for.  it was a good read and I recommend it.

My compliments to a new self-published writer. I enjoyed this post-apocalyptic story very much. I enjoyed following Kyle on his walk from Texas back to his family in Montana. Kyle was determined to get back to his family no matter what he had to encounter along the way. We are all so accustomed to our electric powered lives that I can not imagine what it would be like to live without these conveniences. Good job Ray on a well written hypothesis.

This book grabs you from page one. I have never thought about an event such as this. Has changed my way of thinking for sure. Couldn't put this book down. Thank you ray for the entertainment as well as the insight as to possible threats. Keep up the good work

I enjoyed this story, even though the writing isn't particularly strong, and the manuscript is badly in need of copyediting. A good editor would have made it a much stronger story, but as these self-published apocalyptic books go, this was average to better than average.
Kinda scary that this could actually happen. Puts things into perspective. Good read definitely not the best book i've ever read but worth picking it up.

I made the mistake of starting this book at 1:30 in the morning one night when I couldn't sleep.  BAD MOVE! ! I was immediately hooked and wound up reading until 4:30am. The book continued to keep me engrossed and trying to find spare moments to sneak a few pages. I highly recommend!

Good, but too short. It left me wanting more. I liked the writing style, a little verbose in parts, but the story developed quite well, and was only hindered by the shortness of the book. It was almost like the author decided to finish one day, and wrapped it all up in twenty pages. Very hard to put down. Very hard.

I knew nothing about electromagnetic pulse until I read this book. I am not a doomsday prepper and really had no knowledge of doomsday prepping except for one episode of the TV program. I was simply looking for an interesing novel to read. This book was educational as well as interesting. I thought it was very well written and focused on the emotional aspects as well as the physical aspects of dealing with a world without electricity. I found this book to be a page turner and it has stuck with me long after I finished it. As I started to get into the book I found myself going through my daily activities thinking about how difficult each thing would be without electricity and without the safety that we take for granted in our lives today. Pretty scary stuff. With North Korea and Iran gaining nuclear capability and with the radicalism/lunacy of their governments, the scenario portrayed in this book has a lot of possibility of becoming reality. That is something else I paid no attention to before reading this book. I am not stocking up on food supplies or subscribing to survival magazines, but I am more conscious of my own vulnerabilities and some measures I should take to be safer. I definately want to learn more about this subject. I would read other books by this author and I hope he does continue to write. He presented a well told story in a beleiveable manner that I often still think about.

There were a few points I didn't like, but over all, I really liked this book.  At one point I actually felt like I was right there with the character in that damn truck.  He did exactly as I would have done, and I felt just like he did.  Loved the book.

The concept was interesting but I found the characters juvenile in some ways and lacking depth.  The main hero was bit too much of a "Mary Sue" character. I don't regret reading this novel but am not sure I would read any continuing stories of these characters.
Good story.  Characters were well defined and easy to relate to.  Made me reflect on what we take for granted and how I would survive a similar situation.
This book was pretty good. Not too much in the way of a "how to" book if that's what your looking for.
I really enjoyed this book and hope the author decides to do a follow up book. I had heard about EMPs before however; never considered how much it could effect our day to day lives. Kudos to Ray!
A breath of fresh air. I love the way you have placed God in the equation. A very well written book and I couldn't put it down. I will be waiting on the next one

The storyline of 77 days flows effortlessly. I really could not put it down and read the book in a couple of days. Realistic characters and a great story. Great effort Mr. Gorham, I look forward to future books.

An excellent realistic view on what could happen if an EMP did hit us. At the very least this book should open some eyes and make you think for a second. The characters are well written and the story well told. I would have enjoyed perhaps another story line or 2 but it flowed well enough without them. I would certainly recommend this book to others.

An interesting book based on a real possibility.  I always enjoy stories dealing with the end of life as we know it and this book has the extra advantage of its premiss being based on real technology.
I really liked this book.  Think I'll start stocking up on canned goods.  My only complaint was how "neatly" the book ended.

Scary look at a very plausible event. Especially with the current administration ignoring the nuclear threat posed by handful of rogue countries. Also a good example of why the gun control wackos need to shut their pie holes!!!
My adrenaline was pumping throughout most of this book. I really felt like I was walking in the shoes of the characters. Great story of survival and determination.

Spoiler alert!  My one issue with this otherwise enjoyable story.....why would evil terrorists send us back to the pre-industrialized age of helplessness and then not follow up with killing strikes.  Why wouldn't they wipe us out while we could not defend ourselves???

I read another novel called One second after,some time ago, it was also about an EMP  attack. Both books were very good, this one was more  of a personal story and not quite as dark. I would recommend both books for fans of survival stories.
This is an enjoyable and gripping book. I burned through it in one afternoon, and found it very hard to put down!
Wonderful story, excellent writing.  I couldn't put it down.  Please publish soon, I want a hard copy for my collection.
Story and its outcome could be anticipated. I felt that it is not a book that I would recommend to any one unless the person ask for a quick read without much thought.

I've read other stories that have explored the breakdown of the United States, some of which include electromagnetic pulse as a device. Mr. Gorham did a good job taking us through some of the implications. I liked that he split up the narrative to give us glimpses of more than one character trying to survive. I recommend this book to anybody who enjoys more plausible collapse scenarios. 77 Days In September was definitely a "page-turner."
This was a compelling book, one of which I would highly recommend!  Suspenseful, emotional and kept me wanting more. Absolutely loved it.

I just read this book and Ray Gorham did an excellent job of putting you into the story with the people in the book.  I so bonded with those characters that I cried for joy for 10 minutes during the last chapter. I would highly recomment the book.
Well done, well written, believable story.  I've read them all and this is in my top 5. Keep writing. Thanks
Easily the best book I've read in months... so many lessons to be learned about the priorities in life.  THIS BOOK WILL BLESS ALL WHO READ IT!
I loved the story and characters, both very real.  I couldn't put this story down and read it in two days.  I will definitely check out other books by Ray Gorham!

This book was great. I couldnt put it down. It got a wee bit repetative at one point, but then began to pick up speed. In the end I was in tears of joy and relief. Lot of great twists and turns. A must read for any apocalypse book lover!

I enjoyed this book. It had potential to be more but I liked the characters and the possibility that it could happen. I think it could have been longer and gone into much more detail about what it would take to survive. I would recommend it to anyone who enjoys disaster stories.
A good read; well written, with good characters and a plausible story. I read it a single sitting; it was a hard book to put down.
really makes u think about how fast it could all go away!  pray it dosent happen but truly could at any timetime!

I was pleasantly surprised that this book was so good as it was so inexpensive. Sometimes you get what you paid for; not so with this book. It is a quick and easy read, entertaining, and a little too realistic. After reading this book, I feel that maybe I should become a dooms day prepper. After all, An EMP attack a little more likely to happen than a zombie apocalypse.

This was one of the better disaster, prepper type books that I thrive on in my Kindle.  I really like the books that tell of circumstances that the average person might deal with in such a situation.  Not all of us are financially prepared to have a fully stocked bunker set up with fully armed and trained people to man the set up, though i read all those i can get ahold of also.  We do what we can and hope for the best.  This fellow does what he can and hopes for the best.  It was a great read that was hard to put down.  Me being a female, loved the happy ever after ending also..well, as happy as it can be in that type of a situation.  Write more, sir, write more.

I've been reading a lot of zombie books and books about Armageddon as of late, but this is the first one that I came across about a disaster that could actually happen. I read the whole book in one day, it really keep my attention and I just couldn't put it down. The worst and best thing about this book is that it made me realize how little I'm prepared  to sustain myself and my family for any longer length of time(more than a few days). I do believe my family and I will be looking into this much more thoroughly. THANKS FOR THE ENLIGHTENMENT

This book is a good read but it wasn't very exciting nor did it get into any kind of detail about the fallout of society. A lot of the dialog was boring banter between characters. There was some suspense and cliff hangers between chapters but I was expecting more.

The premise sure is pretty good, and then I spent the whole time reading this book waiting for the good parts - they never came - I had a real hard time "suspending disbelief" when reading this book - there were so many stories the author could have told, or places he could have gone with this great premise - instead he focuses only on two people and the husbands ridiculously unbelievable journey home - so close, but the author just doesn't get it done - too bad.

77 days in september is a very profound story of an incident that quite possibly can happen.the book is well written and takes one to the brink of mans ability to conquer an almost impossible journey to walk many many miles in all kinds of weather and possible death to reach his loved ones.i would recommend this book to every person i meet.
This was a great book.  I would recommend it to anyone.  It has something for all readers.  Thanks a lot.
Good thing I started this on a Friday night because I didn't put it down until I had finished. I felt like I had traveled every mile of the 2,000 miles back to Montana with Kyle after the EMP!

What an adventure, from start to finish. If you like apocalyptic books then this one not to miss.  This a "one in one hundred" tale that will make you laugh, cry, cheer, and even loose sleep just wanting to see what happens next. Well worth every penny.
This was the most inspiring story of survival under the most extreme circumstances that I hope we never have to experience.
I loved this book, really got me thinking about the 'what ifs' in life.  Now I kind of want to store up a bunch of food and supplies.
This was a great book. I felt is was well worth my time. Anyone who enjoys reading believable ends time type books will enjoy this one.Great job.

I was surprised when I finished the book, to learn that it was written by an "independent" author who has not written dozens and dozens of books.  It read like a very experienced writer. The story was believable and makes you wonder what you would do in similar circumstances.  This book makes you feel for everyone coping in these dire circumstances.  I would highly recommend this book.

I have a daughter and Kyle reminds me what I would do for her  and go through to be there for her this is currently my favorite book thank you....
