Entertaining read but more of a love story (not bad at that) that a study on what would happen if this truly occurred.
Very entertaining read...makes you stop and think what you would do in this situation and if you would survive. I look forward to more books by this author.
What a great book. Solid storytelling! I was completely caught up in this story and read every chance I got. The author has a very bright future!

I took a chance and purchased this Kindle edition book from an unknown (to me) author, and after finishing the book, I'm very glad I did.  The storyline kept me hooked and I stayed up late into the night reading more than once.  This book has survivalist-type parallels with William Forstchen's "One Second After" as well as Cormac McCarthy's "The Road", but what quietly keeps you from putting the book down is the love story hidden inside, as you follow Kyle Tait on his long journey home to his family.  I will be looking for more titles from this author.

There was an interesting premise, but the writing was very elementary. There was no compelling, driving force behind the novel, and the characters felt very undeveloped. In a world filled with a plethora of post-apocalyptic novels, there are so many other amazing ones to choose from, and this one really just fell short.
A good book about the scary truth.  Really gets you thinking about what life would be like if a disaster like an EMP happened.

I picked up this book after it was suggested by the Amazon system, probably triggered by books such as Earth Abides, which I had recently read.  I started it one day and finished it late two days later.  It was totally engrossing.  I had a hard time even putting it down.  The plot is believable and the tale of overcoming adversity to achieve a seemingly unattainable goal was uplifting.  I often wonder how I would react to an earth-changing situation.  This is a great story of how different people react to crisis.  I really enjoyed the read.  And I think I might do some disaster preparation, just in case.

I loved this book!  Very exciting  and suspenseful, while very informative; I didn't expect to like it as much as I did...I honestly couldn't put it down.  Well worth the time and the money;  I'd say this is my favorite of all my recent reads.  I highly recommend it!
Loved this book!!! Simply loved it!!!! Brought to mind how bad things can get and the love that can get you through it!
scary (but very interesting) set-up of the plot------could happen. Writing was mediocre---but I finished it anyway.  Not exactly great literature

I really enjoyed reading this book.  I could hardly put it down.  I don't usually read books like this one, but I'm so glad I purchased it.

This was a great read. I couldn't wait to pick back up to see how would end. Pretty scary to think this could and will most likely happen. I enjoyed very much. Thank you for making aware there are still guys out there........

It rivets you in the first few pages and putting it down is soooo hard.  I just finished this book and am still riveted by it.  I guarantee you will not be disappointed.

My wife and I both read the Kindle edition of this novel and we were very impressed by the excellent character development of the main protagonists. While Mr. Gorham has instilled enough suspense and excitement in this novel to make this a true "page-turner" - this is also, surprisingly, a very inspiring love story.

Always remember this - it's easier to be a critic than an author.  The 157 customers ( as of this review) who gave Mr. Gorham's book  1, 2 or 3 stars are far outnumbered by the 1322 who gave the book 4 or 5 stars and I'm one of the 5 star people.  I actually downloaded this book a couple of months ago, read the first chapter or so and went on to something else.  I'm glad I came back.  What I learned after returning was the protagonist in this novel wasn't some ex-Seal or CIA operative who just happened to be in the wrong place at the wrong time.  He's someone like you or me who would probably screw up just like he did.  We don't have super powers and aren't mountain men.  He got lucky and he got unlucky, just like we probably would.  The further along I got, the more engrossed I became.  And like all good books I've read - I didn't want it to end.  I'm in the process of writing a novel myself and I know how hard it is.  I'm a voracious reader and after reading thousands of novels (and non-fiction) in my life, I think I know what good writing is when I read it.  This is an excellent post-apocalyptic novel - trust me, it's worth your time.
Enjoyed reading more about the possible affects of an EMP. We as a nation and world need to consider preparing for a catastrophe similar to this. Really enjoyed the book. Couldn't put it down.
The details are very realistic and at the right level.  I recommend this for the writing not necessarily the subject matter.

I have read similar books; this was the best one. I liked the characters. They appeared very believable. Funny, while I was reading this there were articles in the news about the possibility of this happening.
An excellent adventure that is a thoughtful study of human reactions to disaster - both good and bad.  A book that is hard to put down.

This book really made me think!  The author brought up things I would never have considered in an attack like an EMP!  The story was great and kept me turning the pages anxious to learn what happens next!  The characters were believable and had me putting myself in their shoes.  Thank you Mr Gorham for such an enjoyable book.
First story line I have read like this in a while. I read it all the way through. I had to know if he made it!!

I picked the book mainly because it was a bargain.  What a great bargain!  I could not put it down.  The scenario is so believable.  The characters were so real.  I hope this author writes more books like this.  I can't wait.

I was looking for a post apocalyptic book and took a chance on this one. I'm glad I did because it was a book that was hard to put down. The only reason I didnt give it a full 5 stars is because at times it can drag a little, but those times are few and dont last long at all. Not at all what I expected. This book is thoroughly satisfying. I like the plot, the character development. Would have liked to have a little more detail in the book, but still is a excellent read.

Ray Gorman's novel is a chilling reality check that every American should read.  The vulnerability of this nation is our dependence on electronic technology that is extremely vulnerable to both natural and terrorist events.  Mr. Gorman paints a picture of a post-EMP attack America that should resonate with anyone who reads it.  He wisely personalizes the travail of one man and his family in Montana.  Surviving an aborted plane take-off in Houston, Texas, he is forced to walk to his home and family in northwest Montana.  The America which he crosses is simply unrecognizable to the typical citizen who today, goes blissfully about his life without a second thought to a much compromised power grid, a complete dependence on electronic circuitry, and a misplaced faith in a conviction that nothing could ever happen to change our currently comfortable lifestyle.  Gorman's novel is also a cautionary tale about our need for preparedness for an event that is becoming evermore likely in our future.  A good read, and a good wake-up call!

I really enjoyed this book. It is well written and the characters are strong. This book was hard to put down. You have to cheer for this family. It was nice to see a couple who didn't let circumstances be the excuse to cheat on one another.

This is a very good book that was hard to put down. It really makes you feel as if you are experiencing the attack first hand.
I'm surprised this was a first novel. There weren't too many surprises in the book, but it was enjoyable. I'm looking forward to reading more by the author.

I really enjoyed this book.  I wanted to keep reading so I could find out what happened next.  I hope this never truly happens.
Totally enjoyed this book. Well written, with great characters. I've bought a paperback version to loan to friends. Waiting for more from this author.

I enjoyed this apocalyptic thriller for the most part.It is ,for the most part,believeable and well paced.The ending seemed a little rushed,and some of the incidents a little forced and poorly resolved.But, all in all,a solid story and very exciting at times.

I recommend this book as nothing less than 5 stars. Could I protect myself and my family?  Truely friegtening stuff... but very real.  Congratulation to Mr. Gorham.  You nailed a page-turner, and more people need to know about this book.  I am doing my part and have begun to spread the word.  Thanks for a great read.

I never write book reviews, however, this book was so good, I had to.  I couldn't put this book down, always needing to know what was going on in this world of no electric.  I read about two books a week on average and it's been a long time that a book got to me like this one did.  I felt myself living the story.  If you like suspence and something different, I highly recommend this book.
This book takes the reader through some long and exhausting days. Things are are slow at times but in the end I think you will be glad you read this bokk.

This was a pretty good story. I certainly recommend it to all who enjoy apocalyptic stories. This is a very possible scenario with nuclear and missile advancements in countries like North Korea or Iran. And may I add, a proven scientific fact.  We've even EMP'ed ourselves by accident back in the old Pacific testing days. (Hawaii and U.S. high altitude nuclear test.)  Another EMP story recommendation, "One Second After"
Cornball story about a character trying to get home after an emp is set off over the u.s.  the guy should have died due to his stupidity.  Rates one star.
I really enjoyed this book. It was a good easy read, kept me wanting to know what was going to happen next. Very hard book to put down. I could really relate to the main character.
Good plot.  Easy to read and easy to follow.  I like the post-apocalyptic genre and this is a good addition to it.
Scary to realize how unprepared the general public is, including myself! Better to prepared and not need it than the other way around!
Great book.  Well written and researched. Look forward to more books. Keep them coming with exciting characters and good stories.

Took a chance because of the genre despite the abundance of poorly written stories out these days. This book was well written, has a flowing story line, and developed, engaging characters. I hope the author is successful and publishes more.

I really enjoyed the book's premise and it certainly made me think.  The author's research and vision of the threat (EMPs) that could throw our country back in time 150 years seem realistic and very scary.  Made me want to plant my own backyard produce and buy some guns for protection! :)
This is a well-written book and I would recommend it to anyone interested in a good survival story.  This was the second end of the world book that I read.

This is a post-apocalypse book that will keep you turning page after page.  I found that I couldn't put it down.  Sure cost me a lot of sleep until I finished this one.  Great characters, compelling plot, and keeps you on the edge of your seat.  Mr. Gorham wrote a jewel with this one.
Nice story about love and devotion, during a time of disaster and hardship. A quick read that's hard to put down.
Good book with nicely defined characters. Good ideas of post world life. Would love a sequel or another  pilgrimages author

This was a great book. It took me a bit to get into it only because I don't have a lot of time to read. But the story is awesome. It absolutely did not seem like a 700 page book because the content keeps you turning the pages.  I love reading end of the world type books. This was very well written. Glad I took a chance!
This is the type of book that you want to hurry and get back to every evening. Wish I felt that way about all the books I read!

I am fascinated and terrified of the threat of an EMP so I read many books on the subject. This book not only fed into that interest of mine but, it was also a love story. It was about the love and will of a man to return to his family after an EMP attack. It was an emotional story which I couldn't put down!!!
Just read. Seriously. This is one of the best books I've read in a while and I read it in under 5 hours. Flows great and is well written.
Thoroughly enjoyed this book, although now I go around wondering if this could happen for real. Makes you want to stock up the food and water supplies!
Aside from a misunderstanding about the military culture early in the work, it is otherwise first rate....indeed a book having "classic" in its future resume.

at 1st I thought what is this about but once I got into the book it has now became one of my favorite and recommende books.  It is about human hope and struggle and definately give you something to think about and to consider the posibilities of our future
I was really excited to read this book. The only thing that bothered me was that some parts were drawn out.

keeps interest from first,although it can be scarey. makes you think of things that you would rather not happen. I especially related to some of the locations in the book, I have friends that live west of San Angelo and Lubbock is my  home town, all of which made it very real to me. get busy and write another.

This book is a page burner, good luck putting it down.  The author does a wonderful job of bringing the story together.  I very much liked that there is no bad language.  Don't miss this book, one of the better that I have read.
I enjoyed this book, and would recommend it. It makes you think about how you would back when civilization brakes down.
Great read.  Had finish it. Cost me half a nights sleep but well worth it, would be interesting to see if it goes farther

Excellent writing and insite to the potential situation. In reality, this book could have been written in a 2 or 3 book series. So many different concepts could have been explored and this is an author that could have expanded the subject effectively.

The story OK, but not a favorite, kind of flat. Some odd scenarios made me scrunch up my face.  Stole a bunch of stuff, but not a bicycle?  Also, little lacking in details. One other thing that bothered me, the protagonist seemed more of some kind of thinly veiled lesson plan than a real character. Lack of flaws make me wary.  But, did finish it, so something kept me turning the pages.

This book was recommended by a lady I work with, so I downloaded it.  From the very beginning I was drawn into the story and just kept reading because I didn't want to stop.  The scariest thing about this book is the fact that it could really happen.  I believe things would be just as serious as the book has portrayed.  I have been on this earth long enough to function without electricity, cell phones, computers, etc.  But, a lot of our young people would not know how to survive.  Excellent reading and I hope he writes another one!

I really enjoyed this and was disappointed when it was over, not because it ended badly but because it was just that good. Everyone will identify with these characters and what they go through. It is rare to have this kind of investment in your characters and I commend the author on it. Really fantastic read. Don't hesitate, read it.
i thoroughly enjoyed this book.  Scary exciting, and believable.  hope to read more by this author soon if I can find it.
I withhold my 5 stars for only the best of the best, and this was it! Great fun read, didn't find any dangling strings, or any "... no way!!.." in this book.  Was very hard to put down.
This is one of the best books of 2012!  We're all so dependent on our electronics, so how would we cope without them.  Loved this book.
This book was amazing. It keeps you on your toes. I couldn't put it down. Just that fact that someone would do that for there family is just awesome !

Mr. Ray Gorham wrote about a believable sequence of events in today's world that could happen.  I thought the characters in the book were also developed well.  Made you as you read along feel the emotion of the character.  I thoroughly enjoyed the book.  Made me think to my self as I read what would I do.  The author took the time to lay out the options available and led you willingly down the best path. Sometimes the easiest path is not the best for the intended results. I can't imagine a follow up story with these same characters because they have been through enough.  But, I do hope the author will develop more stories as time permits.  I will watch for this authors works in the future. I recommend this book.

Intensely exhausting journey made by a devoted husband and father following an EMP strike. The story unfolded well and I enjoyed reading both perspectives (Kyle's and his family's) as his journey brings them closer together both literally and figuratively. It was hard to put my Kindle down once I started reading because of the strong desire to find out what happens next. The story is well written and invokes various emotions from the reader with a powerful ending. Self-preparation info in the appendix is also appreciated and this reader will definitely check it out!

Neat story about a family separated by distance and unable to communicate in a scarily plausible catastrophe. The author does a good job portraying the struggles that lie on the other side of societal collapse. Having lived through the 9/11 attack on the Pentagon, this book reminds me that we need to be prepared for the unexpected.
Great storyline and towards the end I found it hard to put the book down because I needed to know what happens
Well written. Couldn't put the book down. Makes you take a look around and appreciate what we/you have and how easily it can all be taken away.
Not bad but not what I expected. Not as much an apocalyptic book as a book about conviction, fortitude, and will. I would recommend this as a book about human will and family.
An excellent book.  Hard to put down.  the story has such mpact that I dreamed about it one night.  I talk about it to all my friends.  Great job Mr Gorham!!
The story was a real page turner, very easy to read, storyline made you think about how real the situation could be.

Ray, I enjoyed reading your work. To All Others: I think that anyone who reads this will not only enjoy it, but the writer captured the mindset of our nation and how quickly it would self destruct. It gives you something to think about.
This was  a good book with a good story. However, then ending was too predictable. I would recommend it. I liked the sci-fi but not the sugary romance.
Loved the book! I never have time to read..but made time to finish this one.  I would recommend this book.
Awesome book. Almost as good as One Second After. We should all realize what Kyle found out before an event happens.
This book was action packed and sentimental at the same time.  It made me think of thinks I'd never really thought about before.  Great read.

This really gives you food for thought! We live like this could never happen but in reality it could under the right circumstances. It is something we should all think about and maybe be aware of the situations in the world.
This book is a real wake up call for not taking all our electronic goodies for granted-- TV, radio, PC, electricity, etc.

I enjoyed this book.  The premise for the doomsday scenario is one I hadn't really considered before and was very thought provoking in that regard.  The main characters were well-developed.  If I had one complaint for the story it was that to me, even though the main characters journey to get home is very interesting, to me the more interesting story is what happens after that.  Maybe there's a sequel in the works?

When I first learned of EMP and deduced that it would be easier for an enemy to accomplish than a dirty bomb and have farther reaching and more devasting results, I pushed these thoughts to the hintermost regions of my mind. Now having finished "77 Days in September" in one sitting, I am satisfied that the price was well worth it for more than just the exciting and truly believable tale with true to life characters. For Kyle and his family have made me determined to begin a family preparedness program that can be incorporated into our daily lives. And I will be looking for other Ray Gorham offerings for sure. Thank you Ray and the entire Gorham family.

I buy a lot of these inexpensive kindle books to fill my commute but this one was actually very good. It's interesting to think about what you really would do if our entire country was forced back 100 years (in terms of technology). It was a good quick read.

This is a pretty good book about a man's survival efforts as he tries to get home to his wife and family in Montana after an EMP blast knocks out the country's electrical grid and all communication and transportation systems.  He's in Texas at the time of the blast...and has to walk home.  The story alternates between his survival adventures during his walk home, and that of his wife and kids in their relatively `safe' community in rural Montana (who have no idea whether he has survived or not). An easy read.
This fast-paced story is really about love and honor. It's a reminder to us all to be prepared and as self-sufficient as possible.
Another one I couldn't put down. This book makes you feel like you can get through any "bad" day, awesome!
This is still a story I would recommend. But, if you really want to read a very good but similar type story - read "One Second After".
Well written view into a potential danger facing such a "developed" country as the U.S..  Very realistic and disturbing, which resulted in a page-turner.

I am a huge fan of this type of story, but I didn't like this one. I found several problems with the characters actions. The main characters are constantly bullied, and continue to make poor decisions.
What an interesting premise. The plot sounds depressing but was fascinating. It brought out the worst and best in the characters caught in a terrifying situation.

I have never read a book that I enjoy more or would recommend to more people.  I am ordering hardback cover for my son, bought it for my grandson on kindle.  I could not lay it down.  This book and this author are awesome and I am looking forward to his next book.
Was a fun scary to think about book. One character actually caused me to lose sleep a couple of nights. If you read the book, you'll figure out who it was.

I didn't expect much because many of the inexpensive e-books I've tried were not worth reading, but this one was a very pleasant surprise.  It is well-written and keeps your interest right up to the end.  It was realistic without a lot of the dispusting details that so many authors seem to need to fill up their books.  I really like stories where someone has to rely on their wits to get themselves out of a difficult situation.  This is a good one!

When I got my kindle this was my first download and it was very enjoyable. good insight into one man's mind when the world loses electricity and what he goes through to get home to his family. I don't know if I coauld be as strong as him.
This is one great book.  I could not put it down.  It was like a rollercoaster ride. The writing was compelling.

It was good to have a post-disaster survival story about a nice guy I could like dealing with a bad situation that is truly possible. An EMP is truly one of our largest dangers. If I see Ray Gorham again, I'll probably get a copy.
Great book. It was so real and so scary that after I finished reading it I went out and bought survival food and supplies.

I don't usually read survivalist books. This one began strong. The impact of the catastrophe is immediate and keeps the reader fascinated, not wanting to put the book down. Unfortunately, half way through the book it loses momentum. There is also a lack of research evident that let this reader guess the author is a woman. There is too much explanation of people's feelings. Kyle and Jennifer love each other. That does not have to be repeated on each page. It is highly doubtful that even in a case of a catastrophe of this magnitude there would be a complete break down of the government. We have a military that would be able to take over under martial law that enompasses several million members if the reserve were called upon. Military and law enforcement have plans to deal with catastrophes. There would be curfews and order within days. Modern technology is overated anyway. People would resort to simpeler things quickly. Remember the "Truemmerfrauen" in Germany, who rebuilt that country within a year, often without electricity. All in all, it is worth reading and thinking about. I hope the next book has a little more research. The Marines are not stationed in Germany:)
Could not put it down. Literally, started it in the morning and read till I finished it. I felt as if I was there watching every step. Thoroughly enjoyed. Looking forward to Ray's next books.
This is a thought-provoking book.  I didn't want to put it down. Thanks to Mr. Gorham for creating this book.

I have read about EMP attacks being a possibility in our country. My son (an electrical engineer), recommended this book to me. The book was interesting from the first page. It made me feel like it was actually happening and was very real. It definitely made me think about what I need to do to better prepare my family for this occurrence, God forbid it should ever happen. I highly recommend this book, you won't be disappointed.

I purchased this book early this morning and could not stop reading until I finished it! It was a fantastic story, well thought out and detailed in just the right way to make you feel for the people involved. This is the genre of book that I read most, and with several dozen on my kindle, I think this has been the first one where I did not find a single misspelled word or typo! Bravo Ray Gorham, thank you for a wonderful day of reading.

With the "end of the world" prediction approaching, and living in an area that was severely affected by Sandy, this story line was so accurate in how things truly do "shut down".  I loved the balance of the good in people who step up and help even when they don't have anything themselves.  We have lived this story this past 3 months since the storm.  Kudo's to the author for getting it right.

I would have rated this much higher if not for the distracting segues. The concept of the book are truly frightening. The book opens up great, but tails off at the end. An interesting read and well worth the time.
I couldn't put this one down it was amazing from the first page to the last if your reading this u might as well buy thus masterpiece

I loved this book.  The characters were real to me and I was with them all the way.  I have to admit that this book scared me to death thinking that it could really happen.  I pray that it does not but the book enlightened me to the possibility.  I would definitely recommend this book, it was a great read!
I found the premise interesting and the descriptions of the chaos after an event such as an EMP believable.  The character conversations were occasionally stilted.

I loved the first few chapters of this novel. Fantastic premise, but then instead of exploring it the author chooses to write about the cross country journey of a single individual who want to return to their family, turning the book in to every other survival story. More of a romance novel than anything else.

I thoroughly enjoyed this book. There is a lot of action and if you enjoy tales of survival, you will enjoy this book.  There are a lot of typos, though. Editors need to be a little more alert. I found quite a few errors as I read and it was a little distracting. It's just a good thing that the story-telling is so good.

I read it all, it is strangely captivating. The author has a few sexist (old fashioned?) themes running through it, that if they weren't in it, it would be more highly recommended. It was hard to get past the idea of the wife being so puritan that she was horrified when she found out that her husband had dated other people before her. And it's not religious. Anyway, a good idea about post-pulse times - lots of detail, but maybe you should check out The Road or Cell

Amazing book. If author continues to deliver, then he will be the next household author. Keep up the good work. Looking for other works you have done as I type this. Will be on the lookout for future books.
This was a hard book to put down. I gave  it 5 stars because it's very truthful of what a lot of people would do in the same situation, myself as well. I highly recommend this book to anyone.
I liked this book not SciFi but real possibilities of what the future may hold. A scary glimpse at a future with nuclear weapons. A bit too much religion for me.

I've read a number of books in this genre (post-apocalyptic/post-national disaster), and this is a good one. The main male character has to make some tough choices, and it makes the reader ask themselves if they would be able to cope given the same situations. The main male character even notes that he's not prepared to make those kinds of decisions, that he hadn't had to do so before. I think the author did well not to plod along with the long hike, skipping only to those bits pertinent to the story - a failing so many other authors in the genre seem to have. Also, it was nice not to have CB, ham radio or the military take a big place in the story (although I would like to think we hams would re-establish long distance communications post-event). I would definitely buy another book from this author, whether it was in the same "universe" or not.
Great book and story. Didn't put it down. Makes you want to go out and buy a gun in case this happens...
Fascinating concept and investigation of our dependency on Electricity and how quickly our society can and will break down without it.
Loved it.  Had a beginning, middle and end that could actually occur in the way it was written.  Would definitely read more from this author
I enjoyed this book. I finished it 2 weeks ago and am still thinking about parts of the book.  Thanks for an interesting read.

Very thought provoking. This book brings to the forefront things that we all will face in the event of such a distaster. A great book for those who will take the time to pre-plan for a bad scenario. The book caused me to re-think my plans and make some changes in preparation.
I loved this book.  It was a super thought provoking book.  I would recommend to anyone who likes this genre

This book was interesting to me for the reasons that it was a bit science fiction, with the whole scenario of the terrible power outage and in that it was pretty morally clean for a recently published book.  I liked the fact that Kyle always thought of his wife when he was tempted to commit immorality with a woman.  It was his family he was concerned about;  not himself.  And his love for them was the driving force that kept him heading toward home.  Good entertainment if you aren't looking for "blood and guts".  ;-)
Book was exciting from beginning to end. I enjoyed it ,it also brings up questions of survival......if it happened what would you do?
This book was scary, made me think about survival but was so interesting I couldn't put it down. Worth it.
This book catches your attention  from the  very beginning. It was very hard to put down . Very realistic .
It was a great book. It was well paced and easy to read. It kept my interest throughout. I began to like the characters and wanted to know how they ended up. Can't ask for more than that.
Powerful story. The struggles our society will face are difficult to imagine but we could face them any day.  Books like this help raise awareness.
I enjoyed this allot!  Made me think about how I would react in this new world!  Well written, could not pug it down!

This book opened my mind to the possibilities of a (relatively speaking) higher likelihood attack on the United States. Of course, to some degree, most of us don't have any way to know how likely this kind of EMP attack is, and I'm not convinced it could or would happen, but it's certainly more likely than many disaster scenarios written about, and here, it's written effectively. I like the unexpected moral quandaries - would you normally kill to protect a working vehicle, or a storage of food? What about in a situation where those items might mean life or death for you, or your family? I thought character development was great for the main protagonist, but I wasn't entirely sold on some of the other characters, or his family. Overall? Great read, recommend it to anyone who likes post-apocalypse / fiction / thriller style books.
Could not put this book down. It gives you a lot of food for thought. Maybe those survivalist are not all that crazy.

The idea of this novel caught my eye but it missed the mark. The concept that the world will forever be changed by the EMP event had so many possibilities to explore but the author decided to develop 2 very predictable plot lines that rarely discussed the EMP ramifications. I kept waiting for another twist in the book that would take us away from the two shallow plot lines to a look at the global implications and what the rest of the world was doing to assist us. The 77 days of his journey really was nothing to cheer about. There were times I would speed read to get to the next day of events. The other plot line regarding his family 1600 miles away was not believable and sometimes you just wanted to scream at the character and say are you stupid or are you working at being stupid. I expected more and I think the author missed a great opportunity to not only have a 2 plot story but to also have another story line that went into the EMP implications.
I reallly liked this book.  It really moved along very well, and the characters were very believable.  he scenario is a very sobering one also.
Wasn't sure I would like this book but it was a winner.  Right from the beginning I was hooked.  Different type of book from what I've read in the past.

In this post-apocrophyl world, a man has to make his way home to his loved ones.  Technology has gone kaput and everyone has to cope pioneer-style.  We find out what a man will do for food, shelter, safety in this world.  I kept comparing this book with a series I really like, The Change novels by S. M. Stirling.  If you like a quick read about what it might be like if technology failed, try this book.  If you like very long, detailed story where the author creates a world for your imagination to inhabit, read The Change novels.
This book was simply fantastic. Such a handle on human behavior and values, and values, or lack of them. Good fashioned Golden Rule and survival both.
Good plot premise but the writing needs to be tightened up. Here is where an independent author can really use an editor.

A well written, well researched read.  I especially liked the afterward where he thanked readers for reading and supporting new authors like him.  An accurate novel of what things would be like if an EMP hit.  Definitely recommend for those that like the apocalyptic novels.

The book started very well.  I thought I was going to be one of those books you just can't put down.  I was totally riveted for the first few chapters and then I felt like the book ran out of steam and it became a bit boring.  There was so much more the author could have done with it, having built up this incredible start to the story.  It could even have turned into a series of books, had he kept up the action and tension that the book started with.  After the first few chapters, I was skipping pages hoping it would get back on track, but it didn't really.  I must also say that I am a very fussy reader and fans of this genre will be missing out if they don't read this book.

I thought the book was good at opening your eyes to what would happen if an EMP attack were to happen.  Everything seemed in line with other books I have read on the subject.  I was kind of let down by the fact that the author didn't go further into an attack on the US by other countries who don't like us given our vulnerable state.  It mentioned the possibility in the beginning, but didn't go any deeper.  Over all it was a good story about what people are willing to do to survive and get back to those they have been sperated from.
Couldn't put this book down.  Love his writing style & the content.  Really makes you think & can't wait for more books from him.  Will definitely buy all.

What a great page turner!  I don't think I've ever read a book so fast.  Simply hard to put down and great read.  Makes you think how fragile our technology based country might be.  Hope to find more from the same author.
This is one of the best books I have read in a long  time. It will make you cry at the end.

I started this book and did not want to put it down. I stayed up too late reading and wished I could have read all night.the characters felt like people I know and the description as to how people react in a crisis was both heart-warming and frightening. I have already recommended this book to friends.
Hearty struggles and the commitment to family make this tale of a man 's quest and a woman's determination to have her family intact again a most worthwhile read.

This book is a good example of why publishing houses need to stop just depending on already established authors for sales and take chances with relative unknowns. This book was very, very good. My only complaint is that I wish it had been longer. The adventures the man had trying to get home to Jennifer and his kids was gripping. It could have been entirely about that, and I still would have liked it. I think a little more could have been made of the Doug/Jennifer aspect, but I believe Mr. Gorham's focus was to show more of the survivalist mentality and promote understanding of the idea of what an event like what took place in the book (the explosion several miles above the US) could entail. All in all, what a great read.
I loved the suspense of this book! It was educating and emotional as we share this families struggle to reunite. I wanted it to last longer.
Scary but I believe it could actually happen. Makes you appreciate what you have and realize what is truly important.
I hope this dosen't give any of our terrorist enemies ideas.  Mr. Gorham made the story seem real with interesting charactors and interesting plots

A great read!  I admittedly love reading "Oh holy cow the world went crazy" stories and films, and this was not a disappointment.  The premise was plausible and well thought out, the characters were developed well - although I did find the main character's wife to be a little one-dimensional - and the story had a nice tidy ending.  A nice weekend read.

One of the best books I have read all year - a real eye-opener! Once I started it I could not put it down - a real page turner. Let us hope this stays a story and never happens.  I felt like I could feel what this character was going through.  The cold was bone chilling, the hunger unrelenting. A true survival story.

Extremely well written. Very believable story. There were a few situations I felt were not handled well but overall, it made me feel like I was experiencing the trials and tribulations with Kyle to the point I was following his trek on a map. I will look forward to reading other works from Mr. Gorham.
I really enjoyed this book. I actually loved everything about it and hated it when it was over. Thanks, I hope there are books like this.
A great read! Really opens your mind up to situations you would never think could happen. Had me hooked from the very beginning!!! Keep em coming!!! :)

This is a very well written story about an EMP attack on the USA.  It's about the members of a small town, Deer Creek, in Montana & how they cope with the loss of electricity & communication, with no help from the government.  It's also about a man from Deer Creek, and his struggle & persistence to get home to his beloved family, after being stranded 2000 miles from home.  This is an amazing story of courage, love, & survival.

I think that it is an easy read.  It seems realistic...which is kind of scary to think about...going back to the pre-electrical age.  The author pulls you into the various characters' plights.  A great read!
This book was ok for reading at work. Good pacing but the story needed more substance to rate more stars.

The apocalyptic idea of nuclear devastation from the upper atmosphere is a fantastic premise for a story. In the hands of a more experienced author, this really could have been a fabulous story. However, the writing is sophomoric at times, especially the dialogue, which makes the character's conversation seem as horribly stilted as something along the lines of, "See Spot. See Spot run." I do not regret reading this book, I just wish Mr. Gorham would have had the benefit of a better editor.

This book will stay with you long after you are done reading it. I thought about it for weeks after I finished it and still think about it now and then. I think Ray Gorham did an outstanding job of hooking you from page one and holding your interest until the tears flow at the end.  Good Job Ray! Can't wait for your next book.
The title caught my attention and the reading was not disappointing.  This was my first read by this author.  I will read more of his books.
Quick read, couldn't put it down. I found myself really wanting Kyle to get home! Will pick up the next thing this Author writes, for sure.

This author kept me interested and I found myself looking forward to another sit down to read again.  I wish the main character had of been more of a fighter than this guy was.  I felt like I wanted to get in there and bust some heads myself.  All in all it was a good read.
Excellent book!  I could not put it down, and I did not want it to end!  I've read thousands of books and this is only the second book where I cried at the end.
One of those books you can't put down. Great scenario for a film too! Nearly wept at the end.. Thank you Ray!
I could stop reading this book .  Wanted more at the end. Character were great. Would like to read another by this author.  Take a day for yourself and read this.  Enjoy and happy reading
My wife and IT talk about this kind of scenario almost everyday and how we would prepare. This book gave me an amazing perspective.
This was the best thing I've read in quite a while!  I couldn't put it down! I have never read anything from this author before, but will definitely be looking for him in the future!
Well written story of a regular guy caught up in events beyond his control. Very believable plot, scarily believable. Characters are well developed and writing style is excellent. I enjoyed the book.

very thought provoking, definately will not be buying a electric car and will now grow my own vegatables, it would be as bad as  a nucelar bomb , trying to survive , we take so much for ganted.god help us.
A tale of struggle and survival, man at his best and at his worst.  Great way to spend a rainy day.
great book! Couldn't put it down after the first ten pages ! Look forward to reading more from this author.
Should have spent less time remembering and more on the dangers Doug would have faced on the road. More about gathering food and staying alive.

I thoroughly enjoyed this book and could not put it down.  It opened my eyes to the possibility of an EMP, which I had never heard of before.  The only thing that bothered me is wondering why Kyle walked and did not, at least, use a bicycle.  Aside from that, it made me think about what my family and I would do and how we would survive if faced with this devastating situation.
Awesome book, started reading and couldn't put it down! This book makes me want to get my family more prepared for the "impossible".

I initially purchased this kindle edition book for a couple of stupid reasons. First it was cheaper than most but mostly because it was about a guy from Montana where I live.  Also the plot description sounded interesting.  I was most pleased when I got into the book.  I couldn't put it down and it turned out to be a very good find.  The book was easy reading and the characters were well developed.  I look forward to additional books from this author.

I rarely ever write a review, but this book was great. It provoked fear of a possible reality as well as sadness, anger, hope and joy. It brought me to tears and any book that can do that is worthy of a five star review. Read this book, you will not regret it.
This was recommended by a fellow thriller fan, and is breathtakingly scary because it is so believable.  But what I hadn't expected was the beautiful love story that left me crying with joy.

A definite eye opener. I would like to thank the author of this amazing book for bringing to light something that everyone should consider and prepare for...no matter how likely or unlikely this may seem to them.  Well written, didn't set down my kindle for two days straight!
Good book, great characters. I think very realistic. What you would expect if you were 1,500 miles from home when the world died. If it was longer I would give it a five.
This book was very well written and kept me turning the pages all night! Great read! You won't be disappointed!
This is an American story about a man's love for his family in the context of a national disaster. The events in this book are all very possible. I want more from Mr. Gorham
This book isn't up to standards as far as "good reading" goes...  simplistic plot... tiresome characters...  I can't do better but I'm not a writer either.

If you like SHTF stories, this is a great one.  Kyle's story is one of strength, determination, and character.  His struggle to get home is inspiring and also educational, giving the reader a lot to think about and practical ideas.

This book caught my interest in the first paragraphs and kept it all the way through.  Loved the development of the characters and the flow of the story.  I spent a day reading it because I wanted to see what happened next.  It left me wanting more of the characters and their stories.

This was an awesome read! Never wanted to put it down! Also was an eye-opener to a very realistic situation in a world where we rely heavily on electronics, probably entirely too much! Very well composed and flowed nice. If there was 6 stars I would have given it 6!

After reading a few disappointing books I searched around for something to read that would keep me reading and stop my yawning.  77 days in September was the answer to my quest.  Everything we do in our lives is facilitated by the power-grid  our communication systems and water and gas pipelines.  This author has captured the helplessness and desperation that we would experience with depth and compassion.  It is so great to have a compelling read that is told without constant flashbacks. Thank you Mr. Gorham!!!

I haven't been on the edge of my seat reading a story this good in a while. Very well written with great characters. What makes this book so entertaining is the fact that the story line is very realistic and is a very possible scenario that could take place one day. I've never heard of this author but this masterpiece just launched him into the spotlight.
This was a great read!  Couldn't put it down, it wasn't at all what I was expecting.  Scary, gripping, and thought provoking.

Great premise.  Great story.  Very exciting and incredibly well written.  I am an avid reader.  I had never heard of this author, but took a chance because of the many 5-Star reviews.  Those reviews were right, this book is excellent.  I found it impossible to put this book down...
I read so much its hard to remember all the books, but I do know that before I was done with this one I was already telling people about it.
This book made me think about how things would be for my family if this occurred.  Enjoyed  reading this book.  The ending was abrupt.

Couldn't stop telling my wife about this great story that has all the elements I was looking for.  I have been getting into the Armageddon survival type books lately and usually put them down by thesecond chapter.  This one is fantastic however..even the guy that gave you just one star liked it so Bah to a couple misplaced commas.  Cant wait for your next book or your fifty million dollar Hollywood deal. Then I can say I read him back when he wad a small independent!
Enjoyed this book it was very believable. well written and kept my interest throughout the entire book. The author made the characters feel like people l knew.
excellent book about a man and wifes commitment to to do what ever it takes to stay devoted to each other through a terrible situation after an EMP attack on America by terriosts
A thought provoking and very readable book.  Enjoyed it.  I would thoroughly recommend it.  It is interesting how people survive such a catastrophe.
The characters were believable and the action felt realistic. A frightening view of what could happen but an overall positive view of how people would work together.

This book was great.  It gives you a lot to think about as a nation and family. The characters seem so real and the struggles the main character endure are heart wrenching.  But in the end "All is well".  You won't regret buying this book.

I loved the book, my only concern was no in depth detail of. The governments actions and what happened to the senator.  Other then that ky les trip was so interesting, it showed how fast as a nation we  can fall apart. And how good people can come together and reach out to each others

This was a fun read.  It's about time that everything doesn't go exactly as planned or work out so that the hero becomes a 1 man army in a book.  There are too many books about people with 100 years of supplies that go on to take over the abandoned Army base so they can wipe out the gang that has taken control of the next town over.  This is a down to earth story and the characters are believable.  Had a hard time putting it down but wished there was a bit more at the end.  Maybe another weeks or two of story time.

This is the first book of this genre that I have ever read so I may be a bit more forgiving than some of the one star reviews I read on here.  I didn't think this was that horrible of a book.  I didn't think it was that right-wing either.  Not sure why so many people keep saying that. Anyway, I thought the premise was great but I am going to have to agree that our protagonist did make many stupid choices on his long journey and was rescued two or three times too many.  I think this story had a lot of potential and could have been amazing with a bit more character development. I did like the book overall though.  It kept my attention for the most part.  May be good for readers like myself who are just starting out in this genre.  I am definitely going to try some of the other books that other reviewers mentioned.  Keep writing Ray.  The beginning of this book was excellent!

Perhaps other authors picked this writing apart but authors don't write books for the benefit of other authors.  They write them for me, John Q. Public.  I think Mr. Gorham pick a very unusual subject and presented it in a realistic view as to make one think of the horrors of this type of warfare.  I've heard of this type of happening many years ago but this is the first book I've come across devoted to the EMP threat.  There may have been others touching on the subject but I somehow missed them.  How simple it would be to shut down this country with one or two nuclear devices.  The people and the ability to do this is out there.  Don't doubt it for one minute.  Thank you Mr.Gorham for several hours of enjoyable reading.  I look forward to your next venture.

I really enjoyed reading your book and hope you write many more. I think you should continue this genre.... I have found that the threat of emp will probably never leave me. It disturbs me to think this could happen. I laughed at people for y2k... Now I understand the need to be prepared. I fortunately( or unfortunately ) don't think Austalia would be targeted..... Not first anyway. Thought provoking. Thank you.
It was a very gripping story.  I couldn't put the book down.  It really makes one think about what they would do to survive in the event of some horrific terrorist attack.

I read ALOT.  And I have read many books recently that I forget as soon as Im done reading them.  This is not one of them. This book is scary because this is one that could actually happen and is written in a way that makes you believe.  I loved this book.  I so hope the Author writes more because I will buy them all.

I loved this book, couldn't put this book down. It brought light to something that could actually happen in the United States and how different people in different situations would handle the after math. I definitely recommend reading this. Such a great Debut novel by Ray Gorham!
I loved this story and many the time got so lost in it that when I put it down I was suprized that I had electricity! It is frighting that it could happen and definite thought provoking.

I wasn't sure what to expect when I read the preview for this book, but I am so glad I purchased and read it! I was thoroughly hooked and couldn't put it down until I knew the outcome! Thank you Ray Gorham for a great story!
Great book!  Absolutely could not put it down.  Gorham takes us on a journey we all hope we never have to take.

This story was reminiscent of The Road by McCarthy.  Not as lyrical, not as philosophical, but the end of the world as we know it and how people cope. A little too tidy at the end but an interesting journey to live through with the character.

77 Days In September was interesting but a bit amateurish.  The plot was that of what I would call the "plane crash" genre.  There was no doubt that the hero was going to survive.  The science used to back up the plot was correct though and there was some good advice on surviving a digital disaster.  However, there was too much proselytizing.  A really well written book contains characters who take on a life of their own.  Unfortunately, as well meaning as Mr. Gorham is, he seemed to have to wind up and rewind his characters with every chapter.

A well thought out premise turned into a riveting novel of survival. Done with none of the foul language so prevalent in literature of this type, this book was a joy to read and I highly recommend it.
An exciting story about apocalyptic aftermath.  Would recommend for any reader who enjoys this genre of writing.  I plan to follow this author.

I love to read apocalyptic fiction, and I tore through this book in one afternoon, because once I started it I couldn't stop. The story is suspenseful and touching, with realistic characters that are easy to care about. It also avoids many of the cliches inherent in apocalyptic fiction, due primarily to the short time period and the focus on one family and their experiences. Thanks for a great read, Ray!
Good story. Easy to Puck up and recall where u r in the journey. Well written with good characters. Would recommend.

Thought it's a GREAT book!  My wife (her account) set it up for me on a Kindle (didn't want to wait for the printed edition).  While one review said it's "predictable", what isn't anymore?  Well written, thought provoking, and tense moments for the protagonist(s).  I recommend this!  Especially for those who want a "good read", WITHOUT -usually entirely "predictable" - resorting to ubiquitous profanity, nor straying away from what's happening, inserting (ALL too predictable...) steamy romance scenarios, which add nothing - except more pages.  Set this one down, and don't worry that your young son or daughter will get an education in worldly 'sophistication'; they might learn something about the importance of preparedness, however.  I'm ready for the movie, starring Kevin Kostner and Sandra Bullock in the lead roles, with Randy Quaid as the small town lawman!  I'm thinking Steven Speilberg or Ron Howard for producer/director.
100 percent page turner, from page 1. A must read! This book was won of the best books I have ever read, especially from a NO NAME writer. I think we need another book Mr. Gorham.
Very thought provoking, what would you do if suddenly, your life as you know it is turned completely inside out. Really makes you think, would your morals change?

This was a gripping novel that kept me reading constantly until I finished it.  It is very believable. I will be preparing for what I feel is the inevitable future of this country. Thanks for opening my eyes.
Excellent story and very well written. While reading it, you wonder if a light will actually go on when you flip the switch
Very good book it really maks you think about how easly this could happen.It shows how one mans love for his family could give him the drive to not give up

Bravo Mr. Gorham.  Well researched with believable characters and story line.  Retired from a life both in the military and then Police service, this is a topic that causes some anxiety in the first responder circles as there is no protection for such an attack nor any type of real emergency plan to help the population.  Highly recommended not only to read, but to do your own 'due diligence' and research this topic yourself.  With nuclear proliferation on the rise, making it a very real threat that a rogue nation or terrorist group could acquire not only the warhead, but the launch vehicle as well ... should cause you all some restless, sleepless nights.

Loved this book. Had been looking around for a long time to satisfy the need to enjoy a post apocalyptic book Without Zombies - something plausible.  This book has it.  To the author, thank you so much!

I found this book while searching for books in the "end of the world" genre, and it definitely delivers! A well written, well thought out book. The characters are well developed, and the story line flows perfectly.  I found myself yelling out loud at both Kyle and Jennifer at different points in the story, angry with them for decisions they made or actions they didn't take. I wish the book were longer, but only because I didn't want to stop reading. Thank you Ray Gorham for an excellent book!

I read this in a day - so I question the "300 print page" estimate, but I really enjoyed the book and didn't put it down.  Similar story line to "The Road" by Cormac McCarthy, minus the gore.  The author oddly inserted an unrelated small side story about a senator to voice his partisan political views that was a detractor to the main story - but whatever.
Great idea for a book. Fast moving and entertaining from the start. Really enjoyed it. Would have liked to hear more about their survival.

Great job, Ray! I was hooked early on in reading your book "77 Days in September". I found it to be a great mix of adventure, survival, and a depiction of what true love between a man and a woman is all about. I haven't thought about the need for being prepared for any type of calamity, let alone the terrible after effects of a potential EMP. This was certainly eye-opening for me, and was a wonderfully entertaining book all in one. I look forward to reading some additional works of yours!
I absolutely loved this book. Not only is it a great story, it's so believable that it really makes you think. I highly recommend it and was well worth the price. Well done!

I have read several "end of the world as we know it" books and this one comes in the middle of the pack.  I read the book in two evenings. For $3.99 I didn't expect a masterpiece, but I did find it an interesting read. If you enjoy this genre of novel, I wouldn't hesitate to get it.

The story premise was believable, and I related to the main characters, but the author seemed indecisive about which genre style  to focus on. The book attempts to be a thriller, but  most of the plot development focused on the moral dilemmas that arise as the characters deal with their new situation(s.) Any action seemed an afterthought. (And the action scenes were well written.)
First book I've read by this author. Loved the book. Gives you lots to consider with the things we all take for granted.
Fast-paced, informative and stark view of what the world might look like should an EMP scanario ever unfold.  Good read

The most exciting new author I have found in a long time. Not only is the topic fascinating but the author's writing is beautiful, engaging, perfectly descriptive and a joy to behold. Why he is not picked up yet by a major publisher I do not know but I think he is destined for great things. I look forward to reading more from this author.
Really enjoyed this book!  Nice to read a story where people actually are choosing to do the right thing and the importance of family.
Really makes you think about what would I do and how would I get where I need to be if an EMP did happen.

As a post-apocalyptic story, which I have strangely become interested in, this was a pretty decent read.  I end up not finishing alot of books because the writer just came seem to keep the interest going, but in ths case, the writer did a decent job in keeping the story progressing.  It bogs down in a few spots, and I just couldn't understand why the lead character didn't have the brains to find at least a bicycle to get himself across country, but the failings in the story weren't enough to make me abandon the story.  I'd be interested in seeing further works from this author as I feel if his story writing progresses he could be an author that I wait eagerly for their next novel along the lines of Lee Child and Vince Flynn.

This is a wonderful story about the possible break down of all power in a part of the country and the consequences caused by this attack on the United States.It will hold your attention as you follow the main character's effort to get back to his home following the breakdown of all things electrical and his subsequent long walk home from Texas to Montana.

This was an absolutely captivating subject & a book that I simply could not stop reading. The author, Ray Gorham did an exceptional job taking this real life subject matter and putting into believable context how easily humanity can slip into near oblivion through the loss of technology and related items that we all take for granted on a daily basis. I gave this work by Ray Gorham 5 stars and would highly suggest to others that 77 Days in September is a must read!

It was an interesting book and a very real threat which made it that much more relevant. I enjoyed the story and Kyle's journey and all of the people he met along the way. My complaint is that it is much like other books I have read, and as interesting as the story line is we need something new!

this book is great from the start.  I have never written a review so don't know exactly how to go about it.  I read a lot of books and this one is on the top of my list to refer to family and friends.
Excellent book. Couldn't put it down. Very intriguing and well thought out. This is one you will definitely enjoy. I would like to read others by Gorham.

I really injoyed this book it keeps you reading on to see what happens next.I kept tell my friends about it. I got so into it and you can see how this could really happen and I knew all the places that was named following along with it, since I'm from Texas. It is so well written I didn't want to put it down. I would recomend this book.
